access: You have the privacy of your own bathroom & bedroom, as well as an office with an extra futon and an extra bed.
description:
A private basement available in Lincoln Park 2 flat, a nice neighborhood near downtown. The basement will accommodate two people very comfortably with 2 seperate beds, wireless internet, private bathroom with a BASIC/MINIMALIST set up.

The layout allows for a lot of privacy as your rooms and bathroom are located in the basement area of my home. I work from home and occupy the upstairs. I operate an Organic Catering Company called "Goose & Fox", as well as a recording studio. The building itself is over 100 years old and located in awesome part of town.

You have the privacy of your own bathroom & bedroom, as well as an office with an extra futon and an extra bed.

I try to give my guests as much space as I think they want or need. 

If I am around, I am accessible but not in your space, meaning I am working in my office with the door slightly cracked or doing something upstairs while you are downstairs in your bedroom or bathroom. I also operate a recording studio so sometimes I am upstairs recording stuff. I also have two friendly dogs who generally hang with me in the office. They sometimes bark when people arrive but are super friendly after a couple minutes. They do not have access to the basement. 

On the other hand, if you need answers or just want to talk, I always enjoy this part of the host experience.

I try to let the guest set the pace when it comes to how much interaction we have.

The place is located in the heart of Historic Lincoln Park with easy access to the Armitage Brown Line stop and the "el".  We are in the best possible location if you need access to downtown we are literally a 5-10 minute train ride away.

Lincoln Park is home to DePaul University and boasts tree-lined lakefront paths for biking/jogging, a vibrant shopping district, beach, dozens of ethnically diverse restaurants, live music venues, movie theaters and more. north avenue beach, and the lakefront, are less than 10 minutes from our home.

Breakfast is offered at an additional charge with your stay but you must verify the time  you want prior to your arrival or the day before when you arrive. Breakfast can be served at any time and is cooked to order so you can sleep in if you need to, but you must arrange it with the host so we can make sure we have everything we need to give you a great breakfast. 

-free coffee/tea during your entire stay 
-full cooked to order breakfast (omelettes, frittattas, potatoes, french toast, pancakes, locally sourced bacon, biscuits & gravy, eggs benedict. special dietary needs are no problem! Your Host is a world class Chef so we can pretty much make anything and it will always be awesome!

I DO NOT PROVIDE PARKING. STOP ASKING ME ABOUT PARKING. WE ARE LOCATED IN A LARGE CITY. PARKING IS DIFFICULT. Public transit is a much better option.

Buses and trains are literally ride outside my front door and about a minute walk from the apartment (train ride downtown is then only a 10 minute ride)

Cabs: No more than a moments wait to flag a cab directly out front of my place day and night. This is a safe area where you can walk around at night as well.

Parking: We are about 5 minutes from downtown so Parking is limited, random and mostly based on luck like any populated urban area. research the neighborhood and plan ahead. I do not provide parking and due to the popularity of the area my recommendations will only go so far. Our location is great for public transit, which we recommend you use.

Here are some tips:

 (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

Or reserve your spot with Spot Hero:

 (Website hidden by Airbnb)

Hostels provide budget-oriented, sociable accommodation where guests can rent a bed, usually a bunk bed, in a dormitory and share a bathroom, lounge and sometimes a kitchen. 

There are several differences between hostels and hotels, including:
Hostels tend to be budget-oriented; rates are considerably lower.
For those who prefer an informal environment, hostels do not usually have the same level of formality as hotels.
For those who prefer to socialize with their fellow guests, hostels usually have more common areas and opportunities to socialize. The dormitory aspect of hostels also increases the social factor.
Hostels are generally self-catering.

PLEASE DO NOT 
- Do anything illegal 
- Smoke inside (Thank You) 
- Invite guests over without prior written approval 
-ask me about parking (do the research, google directions)


Valid IDs will be required upon checking in. 
I can be very flexible with move in and move out times as long as I can get the apartment cleaned for the next airbnb client

DISCLAIMER! 
Now that I have hosted for over a year, I generally prefer more laid back guests who have experience with airbnb. Specifically, Millenials, Artistic types and younger folks going to concerts, work trips etc. This space is not exactly the four seasons but I do my best to make it comfy and affordable. If you are an older more discerning traveler who is going to not follow the rules, read my ad or at least  send me some basic info on the why, when and where when you attempt to book it probably be best for you to stay at a hotel. I also tend to only book people who have experience with home sharing, as new guests tend to not follow the simple requests and like to write 5 paragraph essays on the stain they found on the bathtub.

additional_house_rules:
HOUSE RULES/AGREEMENT UPON BOOKING
- Quiet Hours 11pm -8am
- Shared backyard & stairway quiet hours 9pm-8am
-Absolutely NO parties.  No more than the allotted amount of guests allowed/booked for (no more than 6) should be in the studio at any time.
-There is NO smoking allowed inside the property. (studio, shared stairways, or on the front porch). Please dispose of all cigarette butts and do NOT leave in yard/on sidewalk.
-RESPECT OUR NEIGHBORHOOD. Remember, you're not renting a hotel room, you're renting an apartment in a neighborhood where people live. We ask that you respect our neighborhood and neighbors by keeping your exterior noise level down at ALL times. There are three units in this building and we (and our children) live in one and have permanent tenants in another. Remember that this is our home. Please respect our quiet hours. (11pm - 8am)
-Decorations: Absolutely NO GLITTER, confetti, etc. Any decorations you put up must all be taken down including any tape residue.

access: Entire private apartment is accessible to guests, as well as a shared backyard space. Everything provided in the studio is for guests to use.
description: Soak up the modern charm in this light filled studio. Eclectic accents include a record player with vinyl collection, original artwork, lots of plants, and a comfy outdoor lounge area.
house_rules:
HOUSE RULES/AGREEMENT UPON BOOKING
- Quiet Hours 11pm -8am
- Shared backyard & stairway quiet hours 9pm-8am
-Absolutely NO parties.  No more than the allotted amount of guests allowed/booked for (no more than 6) should be in the studio at any time.
-There is NO smoking allowed inside the property. (studio, shared stairways, or on the front porch). Please dispose of all cigarette butts and do NOT leave in yard/on sidewalk.
-RESPECT OUR NEIGHBORHOOD. Remember, you're not renting a hotel room, you're renting an apartment in a neighborhood where people live. We ask that you respect our neighborhood and neighbors by keeping your exterior noise level down at ALL times. There are three units in this building and we (and our children) live in one and have permanent tenants in another. Remember that this is our home. Please respect our quiet hours. (11pm - 8am)
-Decorations: Absolutely NO GLITTER, confetti, etc. Any decorations you put up must all be taken down including any tape residue.
interaction: The studio apartment is located on the third floor of a three flat building, the host lives on the first floor.
neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is a family-friendly and easily walkable neighborhood. Stroll just steps to historic, tree-lined Logan Boulevard, with easy access to award-winning restaurants, bars and craft breweries, cafes with locally roasted coffee, and unique shops.
notes: Environmentally friendly studio: recycling available and highly encouraged, linens are organic or green-tech certified, all cleaning/laundry supplies are eco-friendly and biodegradable, composting available, Nest energy saving thermostat installed, LED light bulbs
space: Third floor studio apartment with two separate sleeping areas. All areas are open to each other, except private bathroom. The apartment is a walk-up with very steep stairs from 2nd-3rd floor.
summary: Soak up the modern charm in this light filled studio. Eclectic accents include a record player with vinyl collection, original artwork, lots of plants, and a comfy outdoor lounge area.
transit: 10 minute walk to blue line trains (Logan Square, California, or Western stops), 3 minute walk to Western or Fullerton CTA buses, and 3 minute walk to Divvy bike rentals (bring your own helmet!). Apartment is conveniently located just off 90/94 (exit 47A Fullerton/Logan Blvd). Street parking is free and abundant.

additional_house_rules:
- All bookings require a security deposit of $700 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 
- Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. 
- Check-in time is any time after 3 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 
- We do not allow smoking or vaping in the apartment, front steps, back deck, backyard. Breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 
- No pets. If a pet is in the apartment you agree to a $150 fine per night, Plus cost of professional cleaning service -
- Parties or excessive noise are not allowed in the unit. Quiet hours are 10pm to 7:30 am
- If the unit is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $40 for every extra hour of cleaning required. 
- Guests are not allowed to book a stay in their city of residence. 
- Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events. 
- If more guests sleep at the apartment than the number originally stated in the booking, you agree to $200 per person per night fee. 
- If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or to any individuals, let us know immediately. 
- If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guests will be charged $50. This fee is applied to any late checkout between 11 am and 1 pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if we approved a late checkout in advance. 
- When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.

access:
Entire apartment is yours plus outside your back door, is a large deck with a table and chairs where you can enjoy meals or have a glass of wine in our quaint backyard. In winter, have a wine and a snowball fight!

If it is warm out, check our garden in the backyard. Anything we are growing is yours also (usually basil (ahh Pesto), mint, rosemary, jalapeños etc.).

If you are taking a break from restaurant hopping, our kitchen is well stocked for cooking along with a stove/oven, microwave, refrigerator and other small appliances (coffee maker, tea kettle, blender etc.).
description:
Lakeview/Southport Corridor/Wrigleyville is one of the safest and most exciting places in the city. Our 2 unit building is on a quiet tree-lined street, away from the rowdiness and noise of the party streets but still affords you walking access to a huge variety of exceptional restaurants, bars, outdoor activities, entertainment, and an 11 minute walk to Wrigley Field. Our apartment is a great home base to get around the whole city and also relax away from the crowds. Parking permits provided.

We have been part of the Lakeview fabric for over 30 years. We bought our 1890's house over 20 years ago and rehabbed it then. The apartment has 10 foot ceilings and is duplexed down (2 floors) into the garden level where the 2nd and 3rd bedrooms are located. If you played college basketball, you may have to duck your head a bit downstairs. 

Our street is very quiet and neighborly, (many on the street raised their kids here - including us), but close enough to walk to the areas that makes our neighborhood so vibrant. 

Access to the Southport stop on the Brown line "L" is 3 minutes by foot, which will get you to the apartment or all over the city; but why go anywhere else, Lakeview/Southport Corridor has it all. :)

Entire apartment is yours plus outside your back door, is a large deck with a table and chairs where you can enjoy meals or have a glass of wine in our quaint backyard. In winter, have a wine and a snowball fight!

If it is warm out, check our garden in the backyard. Anything we are growing is yours also (usually basil (ahh Pesto), mint, rosemary, jalapeños etc.).

If you are taking a break from restaurant hopping, our kitchen is well stocked for cooking along with a stove/oven, microwave, refrigerator and other small appliances (coffee maker, tea kettle, blender etc.).

Our in home  “Welcome Book” will give you many recommendations for the neighborhood (restaurants, bars, activities, shopping, theater etc). We are Airbnb'ers too, so we have met many different hosts. Our style is fluid; if you need anything or recommendations, we can help. If you are here to chill, that is alright with us too. We are here to give you the support you prefer!

Lakeview/Southport Corridor (the second largest neighborhood in the city) has it all and was voted the #3 big city neighborhood to live, IN THE COUNTRY! by MONEY MAGAZINE. Lakeview encircles the sub neighborhoods of East Lakeview, Central Lakeview, Southport Corridor, Boystown and Wrigleyville — parts of a sum that celebrates diversity, neighborhood living, along with something special for all visitors.

Make sure to hit all the Lakeview commercial streets:
•Belmont Avenue
•Lincoln Avenue
•Southport Avenue
•Halsted Street
•Broadway Avenue 

Here you will find, many locally owned shops/boutiques with clothing from funky vintage to time tested preppy (try to support the local businesses). Additionally the bars/taverns/pubs and dives are certainly places you can’t miss. We have an incredible micro brew scene (Chicago has 83 brewers), and bars of varying pedigree (sports, college designated, dive, music, gay, local watering holes etc) giving you unlimited choices.

We are one block off of Southport Ave which has exceptional food choices from fast casual to fine dining. We are sure you can find something in your wheel-house. Additionally, our bars run from young to sophisticated with everything in between. Southport Lanes right around the corner from the apartment even has a 3 lane bowling alleys with pins that are hand set.

Theater is alive and well in the neighborhood along with comedy, dance and small club music venues - visit the clubs that the major acts played when no one knew them along with some of the new bands on their way up. All within walking distance.  

Our in home  “Welcome Book” will give you many recommendations for the neighborhood.

If you don't need a car, don't bring one, Chicago is built for easy travel and our home is situated perfectly from O'Hare and Midway - your walk from the "L" or a CTA bus is only 3 blocks to the apartment. 

From the apartment, you have several close transit options:
Brown, Red, and Purple "L" Trains,
CTA Buses,
Divvy bike share rack is 2 blocks away,
Lyft, Uber and Taxi are abundant,
The best way - by foot

Lakeview is activity oriented and kid-friendly. Run or bike the lakeshore, play beach volleyball, kayak the river, grab a city shared-bike and explore the 606 trail and different neighborhoods. Take the "L" down to our world class museums or an architectural tour on the Chicago River. 

We have many kid friendly parks with the newest located 1 block away, which was paid for by the neighborhood families and the Cubs - it is awesome!

Parking is available on the streets, but is restricted to permits from 6p-6a and Cub games. We can help you with this.

Additionally, parking garages are nearby and parking services apps such as Spothero and ParkWhiz are very helpful and reasonable.

description:
Cute and private micro studio in phenomenal downtown Wilmette location. Steps from all local restaurants, shopping, and the Metra station. Walkable to Gillson Beach and the Linden CTA stop. Enter through the front gate to an open & shared yard with private single access to the unit.

Approximately 200 SF micro unit with full and twin bunk bed that can sleep up to 3 people. Essentials provided.

Access to the micro studio and small shared yard.

Very quick availability and response.

Steps from all Downtown Wilmette has to offer. Steps from the Metra station which takes you to Downtown Chicago in under 30 minutes.

Walkable to almost everything in Wilmette, including Gillson Beach. CTA Stop is walkable as well

highlights: [{'type': 'LISTING_SUPER_HOST', 'message': 'Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests.', 'headline': 'Maximillian is a Superhost'}]
description:
Enjoy city living in this beautiful home in Roscoe Village near Wrigley field. This house comes with 3 levels of living space with a redone basement. There is free street parking (just beware of city street signs). The home also has a laundry room and extra blankets/pillows.

I will greet you at the house during check in or send you a code via message to let you in the house. I live in the area so if you have any questions, problems or simply need recommendations for dinner, please don't hesitate to call.

A True Gem In Roscoe Village! Charming Roscoe Village 6 bedroom, 3 bathroom single family home. This charming, laidback “village within the city” is filled with casual taverns, independent shops, and cute cafes that spill out onto the sidewalks during the warm weather months. Shop a vintage clothing goldmine at Shangri-La Vintage. Get a free tasting on Sundays at Lush Wine & Spirits. Enjoy seasonal small plates and an approachable wine list on Volo Restaurant Wine Bar’s intimate, year-round patio.

A blocks from Fellger park. Couple blocks away from Hamlin Park offering playground, baseball field, tennis and basketball courts, and outside pool. 20 minute walk or a quick bike to Whole Foods and Mariano's. 10 minutes walk to the Paulina Brown Line.

description:
Beautiful first floor studio apartment in the heart of Jefferson Park.  Close to public transportation with direct routes to O'Hare, Rosemont Entertainment District, and Downtown Chicago.  Steps away from the public park with tennis courts, baseball field, playground, and pool.

550 square feet.  One double-bed.  One euro-lounger convertible sofa that transforms into an additional bed.  Flat-screen TV with local channels and DVD player.  WiFi internet access.  Full kitchen with premium appliances (refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, stove top oven).  Granite counter tops in kitchen and bathroom. Jacuzzi jet bathtub.  Safe and secure building with surveillance cameras.  Reserved parking spot in lot.

You are welcome to use the coin laundry machines in the building.  If you have a vehicle, there is an assigned parking spot in the lot for you to park in.  The lot is safe and secure with video surveillance.

Depending on when you arrive, I should be able to greet you at check-in to provide an overview of the unit and hand off the keys.  After that I can be reached by phone if you need anything else.

Located on the North Side of Chicago, Jefferson Park is a wonderful neighborhood with plenty of restaurants, shops, parks, and the public pool.

This apartment is located 2 blocks from the Jefferson Park Transit Center station which is one of the largest public transportation hubs in Chicago.  There you will have access to the Blue Line L-Train Subway that will take you to and from O'Hare airport, Rosemont Entertainment District, and Downtown Chicago Loop. The station also has a Metra Rail stop that will take you to Edison Park, Arlington Heights, and other suburbs.  The CTA buses will also take you to various destinations around the city.  There is no need for a car but just in case you have one, the I-90 Interstate ramp is less than one mile away which will take you directly downtown in a matter of minutes.

description:
Perfect Lake View location for an AirBnB.  SHORT walk to Brown/Red line trains, Wrigley Field, Southport Corridor, and all the restaurants, bars, shopping, and entertainment you could ever want.  This classic Chicago greystone two-flat has the vintage character people love while allowing for the luxury and comfort of a contemporary remodel.  New kitchen and baths!  Large 50 feet wide yard for bbq or hanging out.  Parking for 2 cars included.  Inquire re 4 Cubs Tickets which may be available.

Apartment includes three bedrooms, two full bathrooms, a large eat-in kitchen, dining room with fireplace, and a large living room.  High ceilings and hardwood floors throughout.

The entire apartment is yours, including a large back yard.  Washer/Dryer in unit.

Call/text Brandon with any questions during your stay.

This is one of the most sought after locations in Chicago.

15 minute El ride (Train) to downtown (also called The Loop).  This is one of the easiest locations in the city for public transportation.

4 Cubs tickets available for all home games. Inquire as to availability.
house_rules: Smoking, pets, and large parties are not allowed.  While the neighborhood is full of action, the apartment is on a quiet side street and we must keep the peaceful environment for our neighbors.  Family gatherings are just fine.

additional_house_rules:
- The responsible renter must be at least 25 years of age to book. Guests under 25 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian for the duration of the reservation.
- 2 dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval.
- The property shall not be used by more than the number of adults and children listed in your reservation.
- All guests shall abide by Vacasa’s good neighbor policy and shall not engage in illegal activity. Quiet hours are from 10 p.m. to 8 a.m.
- If early check-in is available for your reservation, you will be notified by 9am on the morning of your arrival by email. Late check-out is offered whenever possible for a small fee.
- No smoking of any kind is permitted anywhere on the premises.
- No commercial photography or filming is permitted on the property. Tents or other structures may not be erected.
- Renter is liable for any damage to the property and agrees to accept charges to the card on file should damage occur during occupancy.
- Due to local laws, regulations, or Homeowner Association rules, guests may be required to agree to additional terms of service.
- Property Specific terms: ADDITIONAL RENTAL TERMS FOR THE GRAND PLAZA BUILDING

1. Minimum Age.  You certify that you are at least 25 years of age. You agree to be legally responsible for the compliance of all occupants of the Condo with these Grand Plaza Additional Terms, and that anyone younger than 25 is accompanied by a parent or guardian. You agree that you intend to personally occupy the Condo for the full duration of the period for which you have rented this Condo.

2. Maximum Occupancy. You agree that at no time during the period you have rented the home will daytime or overnight occupancy exceed the posted maximum occupancy of 6 persons. Only the guests listed below are authorized to be in the home during the rental period.  Failure to conform to the occupancy requirements of the Vacation Home is a violation of the Code.

3. Noise and Disruptive Activity.  You agree to conduct yourselves in a manner that is respectful of neighbors by, among other things, refraining from making unduly loud or unnecessary outdoor noises, engaging disorderly conduct or any other activity that could interfere with the quiet enjoyment of neighbors or the community. Quiet Hours are enforced between 10pm ad 8am.


4. Specific breeds are not allowed on the property (Dog Friendly Units): Rottweiler, Doberman, German Shepherd, Pit Bull, American Bulldog, American Staffordshire Terrier, Bull Terrier, Chow, Wolf Breeds, or any mix of the aforementioned breeds, and any breed that relates to security or guard dogs. Sub-breeds of the above mentioned breeds are also not allowed on the property. Any other dog may not be allowed at Management’s sole discretion.

description:
Wake up to views of the Chicago skyline and Lake Michigan from the balcony of this 28th floor Grand Plaza suite. The light-filled apartment boasts colorful accents, including a funky blue Vitrola record player. There's access to a shared pool, gym, and business center.

Our pool is outdoor and is open seasonally from Memorial Day to Labor Day (weather permitting).

You must be 25 or older to book this space.

Parking is not included in the cost of your stay. There is parking in the garage on the bottom floor but guests are responsible for the cost. A parking pass will need to be purchased.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the Grand Plaza, a refined high-rise residence in the River North neighborhood, just 4 blocks from the Chicago River. The elegant boutiques on Michigan Avenue's Magnificent Mile are close by. Millennium Park is one mile southeast.
space:
Wake up to views of the Chicago skyline and Lake Michigan at this two-bedroom 28th floor Grand Plaza suite, a perfectly located urban escape with a private balcony and incredible building amenities that include a swimming pool, a fitness center, a game room, a grilling area, and a running track.

You'll find this polished, single-level suite at the Grand Plaza, a refined high-rise residence four blocks from the Chicago River in the River North neighborhood. Spend your days cruising the river on an architectural boat tour, wandering three blocks east to shop the elegant boutiques on Michigan Avenue's Magnificent Mile, attending business meetings in The Loop five blocks south, and picnicking in Millennium Park one mile southeast.

Whether you're visiting the Windy City for business or pleasure, you'll find everything you need here at the intersection of State Street and Grand Avenue. Come home from an afternoon Cubs game to relax in the central AC, toss your jersey in the private washer/dryer, and step into the full kitchen (with a dishwasher) to fix a few snacks and cocktails to enjoy on the balcony. The family dog is also welcome to come along for an additional nightly fee.

Head downstairs to the ninth floor to take advantage of the Grand Plaza's fantastic amenities, whether you choose to take a dip in the outdoor pool, work out and shoot hoops with friends, light one of the gas grills on the sundeck, or retreat to the library, the game room (with a pool table), or the business center. Back inside your suite, you can make dinner plans on the free WiFi or watch a DVD on one of the three cable TVs.

Don't wait another minute to reserve your beautiful Chicago retreat - book your stay at the Grand Plaza today!

*Outdoor pool open Memorial Day-Labor Day (Weather Permitting)

* Please be aware that all guests must be at least 25 years of age unless accompanied by a parent or legal guardian.

**PARKING IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE COST OF YOUR STAY** 
There is a parking garage on the bottom floor of this building, but guests are responsible for the cost. Guests bringing vehicles will need to purchase parking passes from LAZ Parking.

City of Chicago License #2209850

additional_house_rules:
We strive to make each and every guests trip to our home a special one. Please allow us to continue to do so by following a few basic house rules below-

1. Absolutely NO SMOKING. Smoking inside of the house will result in an automatic loss of security deposit. 
2. Please respect our neighbors. We ask that you keep noise levels at a reasonable volume. 
3. Please treat our home as you would your own. We love hosting and want to make sure we are able to provide a consistent and exceptional experience for all current and future guests.

access: The entire home (excluding utility rooms) is available for your enjoyment during your stay.
description:
Welcome to The Fullerton in Logan Square! 

Enjoy four bedrooms, two full bathrooms and a complimentary two-car garage parking during your stay. This home is perfect for both family and group vacations in Chicago. 

Logan Square is a thriving neighborhood filled with amazing art, restaurants and architecture. The neighborhood provides easy access to downtown while avoiding downtown hotel pricing for larger groups.

Upon entering the home you will walk into the sun-filled family room and front seating area. The interior design of the home was built around its mid century modern architecture. 

The dining room is in an open layout alongside the newly remodeled kitchen for sharing meals with family and friends. During your stay we recommend heading over to “the square” and experiencing one of the best farmer’s markets around. 

Each of the four bedrooms includes high comfort mattresses and ample closet space for your stay. The two full bathrooms include a cast iron tub and shower on the upstairs level and a large shower in the downstairs suite level. 

The home also contains three flat screen HD TV’s for your viewing enjoyment. Cable TV available in the upstairs family room. Netflix and streaming included downstairs and upstairs master bedroom. WiFi included. 

•Bedroom 1: King Bed 

•Bedroom 2: Queen Bed 

•Bedroom 3: Two Twin Beds 

•Bedroom 4: Lower Level Suite with Queen Bed 

•Air mattresses: 2 Queen 

Parking accommodations: *Two-Car Garage Parking Included* for your entire stay.

The entire home (excluding utility rooms) is available for your enjoyment during your stay.

We are available anytime during your stay to assist and answer any questions you may have during your trip.

Logan Square is consistently ranked one of the Top 25 hottest neighborhoods in the country. We have included some of our favorite spots on the site as well. Cubs fans you are only five miles from Wrigley Field. Park and Uber/Lyft to the game.

The strong neighborly connection is evident all around-community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands.

At the heart of this community is the actual "square" in Logan Square.  The boulevards themselves are widened thoroughfares that are set apart by grassy, landscaped medians and tall, stately trees that border both its sides. The neighborhood boasts four of them in total and these link together to form Chicago's "Emerald Necklace," an expansive system of interconnected parks and streetscapes dotted with beautifully-restored mansions, handsome greystone homes and majestic churches.

Location: The home is located on a quiet tree-lined street. You are within walking distance to public transportation or a short drive via Uber/Lyft/personal vehicle away form all that the Logan Square neighborhood has to offer. The actual "square" and center of the neighborhood is approximately a 10-15 minute walk from the home, or 1-2 minute car ride away. The best way to get to the square is walking through the neighborhood and enjoying the historic Logan Square architecture.

Heading downtown? You have all of the above options available. *Travel Tip: dependent on group size Uber or Lyft may be most cost effective-even over public transportation.

Keyless entry
WiFi included 
Nest temperature controlled 
Home Security system
Garage parking 
Backyard
2 full bathrooms

*Important note: We ask all guests to please treat our home and neighbors with care and respect during your stay. 

**NO SMOKING** Absolutely NO SMOKING. Smoking will result in automatic loss of security deposit. No exceptions.
house_rules:
We strive to make each and every guests trip to our home a special one. Please allow us to continue to do so by following a few basic house rules below-

1. Absolutely NO SMOKING. Smoking inside of the house will result in an automatic loss of security deposit. 
2. Please respect our neighbors. We ask that you keep noise levels at a reasonable volume. 
3. Please treat our home as you would your own. We love hosting and want to make sure we are able to provide a consistent and exceptional experience for all current and future guests.
interaction: We are available anytime during your stay to assist and answer any questions you may have during your trip.

access:
Please note: Our two dogs live here as well, when we are not home or asleep we keep them in our bedroom but when we are home they will want to interact with you
 While you are here you can use the common areas as much or as little as you want including the kitchen. The bathroom is shared with us and we have flexible schedules but ask that you be efficient so we may all use the facilities. 
 You will receive one set of keys and may come and go as needed, no restrictions on time. 
 There is a large living area and kitchen you are welcome to sit to eat and relax and enjoy our home.  
If separate sleeping spaces are needed let us know and we can provide an additional air bed as well.
description:
Private bedroom, in our industrial South Loop loft.  Sunny, plant filled, eclectic decor and French bulldogs will greet you upon arrival.  Our home is a former warehouse with exposed bricks, original wood flooring and lots of character.  We are located near Chinatown, Soldier Field, Mccormick and Reggies.
The listing is for a private bedroom, we live in the loft with our French bulldogs.  If you do not like dogs or want to pet them you may not be happy in our home. Our frenchies run the show!

The bedroom listed is private while the bathroom, kitchen and common areas are used by my husband and I who live in the loft as well. The common area is home to my large plant collection and eastern facing windows.  We have decorated or home in an eclectic manner which shows our love of vintage and thrift stores. 
 Tea, instant coffee and filtered water is provided along with a small refrigerator, blow dryer, towels and toiletries.  We have cable tv, an Apple TV with Netflix logged in and a few board games for your more chill days.

The living room hosts my large plant collection as well and you are welcome to relax there as well as the kitchen which is in the same open space. 

We have two French Bulldogs who will be home during your stay as well.  These dogs are a part of our family and really love attention from people.  If you do not prefer to be around dogs, and do not plan on petting them and showing them some love this may not be the best Airbnb for your needs.  The dogs love and demand attention from our guests.  
NO ELEVAOTR ON SITE, 2 FLIGHTS OF STAIRS FOR LOFT ACCESS

Please note: Our two dogs live here as well, when we are not home or asleep we keep them in our bedroom but when we are home they will want to interact with you
 While you are here you can use the common areas as much or as little as you want including the kitchen. The bathroom is shared with us and we have flexible schedules but ask that you be efficient so we may all use the facilities. 
 You will receive one set of keys and may come and go as needed, no restrictions on time. 
 There is a large living area and kitchen you are welcome to sit to eat and relax and enjoy our home.  
If separate sleeping spaces are needed let us know and we can provide an additional air bed as well.

Each guest is different and prefers a different amount of socializing.  We will always be available to say hello and chat but understand if you prefer to spend your time in the bedroom on your own.  We provide Netflix for this very reason!  
We are always available by text or message if you need anything at all during your stay.

Please view the listing guidebook for some area attractions we frequent. 
The South Loop is just a few minutes south of Downtown, near Soldier Field, Chinatown and Mccormick Place. Our intersection is Wabash Ave and Cullerton St please look this up in advance for our specific location. We are just a few minutes from most popular tourist destinations such as Museum Campus and have many public transit options right around the corner to take you to the Magnificent Mile shopping, Art institute and Millennium Park.
Chicago Museums are a 10min walk from the front door and Michigan Ave shopping is a short train or Lyft away.  The neighborhood was once known as Motor Row and was home to many car dealerships and vehicle associations.  Our loft was once an auto parts warehouse many, many years ago.  
Our home is  very close to Mccormick place, Northerly Island, Chinatown, Pilsen and downtown making it a very accessible and convenient location for all. Nearby restaurants include: Reggies Rock Bar, Windy City BBQ, Jamaican Jerk Chicken Villa, Opart Thai, Burger Pointe, Pizano's Pizza, Cafe Bionda and Spoke and Bird to name a few.

We are One block from the Mccormick Place Green line station and four blocks from the Chinatown redline station.  Buses that run down State St and Michigan Ave. are one block away and there are Divvy bike shares on the corner. 
On foot walking to the museums and millennium park will take 25-30mins. Michigan Ave shopping is 10mins away by train as are most other downtown attractions like Navy Pier.

There are two flights of stairs leading up to our loft, no elevator on site. 
Also expect typical amounts of city street noise such as sirens, cars and people. 
Again, the common areas such as bathroom and kitchen are shared with my husband and I and our 2 bulldogs.

You may drop off luggage before check in time but once you check out you must take your luggage with you.

Luggage storage is available from 
Usebounce.com and luggage hero.

Parking is available via spot hero.

description:
Justice Hotel at 6018North is a unique art space/hotel. For the Chicago Architectural Biennial we have transformed into a 5 room hotel that embodies ideas and actions that promote justice. We invite you to check into justice through our daily programming included in the room fee.

Justice Hotel is a unique art space within an art-filled mansion. The hotel offers unique programming - created by 10 ALAANA based concierges, for guests to “check in” to justice. Through conversational dinners, performances, movies, and “Sanctuary Sundays,” guests can experience justice in engaging and thought provoking ways. Employing a co-op model of ownership, we are experimenting with living and working together in ways that benefit all. We are bringing the ‘us’ to justice.  Help us create justice room by room. Breakfast and daily event included in price when you ‘check into’ justice.

Justice Hotel is a social experience. We encourage guests to check-in to the programming of the day!

Edgewater is a lakefront community seven miles from downtown on the North side of Chicago. The beach is one block away. Located in a uniquely diverse neighborhood, there is a wide range of ethnic cuisines within walking distance. We have amazing Ethiopian, Thai, Vietnamese and Indian restaurants. The # 1 coffee in Chicago - Metropolis coffee shop - is one block away, as is Indie Cafe, Income Tax restaurant, and the historical Moody's Pub.

Minutes from trains and buses. Located between the Thorndale and Granville Red Line stops. Take the 147 Express bus directly to Water Tower on Michigan Ave.

description:
Adorable Irving Park bungalow, especially perfect for families and longer term rentals. Located 5 minutes from 90/94, close to public transportation, walking distance to bars and restaurants. 3 miles to Wrigley, 4 miles to Lincoln Park, 6 miles to the heart of Michigan Ave., 7 miles to the loop, less than 2 miles to the heart of Logan Square, free permitted street parking. Easy Uber/Lyft rides! It will feel like your home away from home!

Guests have the entire home to themselves! It will feel like your home away from home. There is free and easy street parking with the visitor passes that we will give you during your stay. A rare treat in Chicago!

Guests have the whole house! There is a separate basement apartment with its own entrance that is not included and not rented.

Fast responses through the Airbnb app. Happy to answer any questions!

Irving Park is a great family neighborhood but there are still plenty of bars and restaurants you can walk to. The Golden Nugget (diner), Pitchfork (BBQ and Whiskey bar), Leader bar (sports bar, great menu),  Hearth and Crust (great American food and wine), Raisu (high end sushi), Mima’s Taste of Cuba, Twisted Hippo (brew pub), Angelos (Italian), Taco Max, D’Candela(Peruvian) to name just a few.

Easy and reasonable Ubers and Lyfts. Free permitted street parking (we will give you all the guest passes you need), blue line is a mile away, an easy walk. Only a mile to 90/94. You can also rent bikes through the nearby Divvy stations.

No outside noise after 9:30, we want to be respectful to our neighbors who have small children. No parties or underage bookings.

We have a strictly outdoor-facing ring video doorbell to be able to monitor the street and front door while the house is not in use.

description:
This is a cozy private bedroom with a private bathroom in Chicago’s historical Bronzeville neighborhood. Perfect for young professionals, tourists, or creatively-oriented folks.

Located in a building with large windows, original flooring and wood-work, our apartment is a mix of old and new—a touch of mid-century and contemporary details, with many plants and art by local and international artists giving the apartment that irresistible eclectic note. 

Welcome!

Access to the shared areas and a washer/drier (in the unit), with understanding that this is our home we are welcoming you into it. 

We recently installed shades in the bedroom and touched up our back patio, where guests can lounge surrounded by a variety of lush plants.

The apartment is a work-and-live space that my partner and I share. We are LGBTQ friendly, artistically oriented couple who loves their home, art, and life. As we work from home and we are mostly around we are open to answer to any questions you might have as well as provide advice and suggestions for getting around Chicago.

There is a cute sandwich place, a relaxing coffee shop, and a convenience store located just around the corner. Walking distance to the famous Chicago’s Home of Chicken and Waffle. 

Bronzeville is located on the South Side of Chicago known for its rich history. In the early 20th century, Bronzeville was known as the "Black Metropolis", one of the nation's most significant concentrations of  Black owned businesses. The apartment is located a couple of blocks from the 47th street, the hub of the Bronzeville, with restaurants, galleries, and a variety of shops. 

Short commute to University of Chicago and Hyde Park—where the Obama house is located and the soon to come Obama Library. You can also visit the Hyde Park Art Center or other friendly and diverse businesses that cater to audiences from all around the world.

A 5 min walk to the city train (Green and rush hour Express Red Lines) or multiple bus lines, with a quick 20 minutes ride to the Loop/Chicago downtown area and its tourist destinations, including the Art Institute, Millennium Park and the famous Bean sculpture, Chicago Cultural Center, Magnificent Mile, the Museum of Contemporary Art (MCA), and others. 

Plenty of parking in street if you are coming by car.

description:
Vintage touches and modern updates in the heart of Wrigleyville!  Close enough to see Wrigley Field from the building, yet the block is charming and quiet. The apartment's vintage DNA is beautifully respected while being updated with the modern amenities you expect when traveling. You will love the exposed brick and original millwork while enjoying huge new windows, an open floor plan, chef's kitchen, stylish decor and spa like bathroom.

Building is steps from public transportation (Sheridan stop on "el" red line) Parking included. Walking distance to Lake Michigan for walking, running, biking, golf and much more. Beautifully refinished hardwood floors throughout, big bright windows, a 55" and 50" televisions. Modern kitchen with peninsula with bar seating. AC, ceiling fans in bedrooms. Private back deck with gas grill.

As a lifelong Chicagoan I know the food, music, arts and nightlife scenes. I am happy to make suggestions or just stay out of your way and let you enjoy Chicago.

Wrigley Field! The iconic home of the Chicago Cubs! Also, the number one feature of Chicago is Lake Michigan and it is only a walk away from the place.  While the area surrounding Wrigley is teaming with restaurants and bars, enjoy the nearby Southport corridor for more eating and shopping options. Adjacent Boystown also pulses with fun and activity.

Sheridan stop on the "el" train's Red Line goes directly downtown and all the way to the Evanston border to the north. Proximity to spectacular Lake Shore Drive, a street and tourist destination in it's own right, allows for quick drives into downtown and beyond. Free parking at the unit means feel free to bring your car.

access: All guests will check in with a 24 hour Concierge team member upon arrival.
description:
Take in a view of the best of River North Chicago from the terrace of this modern, well-furnished apartment. Dine in the spacious and ultramodern kitchen, or relax in the elegant, art-filled living room and bedrooms.

LEVEL Furnished Living combines the style and service of a boutique hotel with the space and comfort of a well-appointed luxury apartment. Located in Downtown Chicago River North. This elegant 25-story tower with one and two bedroom fully furnished suites also boasts over 22,000 sq.ft. of private amenities, including a professionally equipped fitness center, heated outdoor pool and hot tub surrounded by private cabanas, as well as alfresco dining areas, cozy firepits, BBQs, and sauna room. Home to premium tenants including Solidcore, Starbucks and Jimmy Jones, LEVEL Furnished Living is a community unlike any other. Each of the furnished apartments features a fully outfitted kitchen with premium Bosch appliances, ample and contemporary living spaces, floor-to-ceiling windows that overlook open-air balconies; multiple 40-50” flat-screen TVs; personal phone lines and in-suite laundry. And, whether it’s a reservation at a Michelin-starred restaurant or a fridge full of groceries, the LEVEL Concierge Team can make it happen 24-hours a day. Additional services such as parking, weekly housekeeping, and pet-friendly suites are also available.

All guests will check in with a 24 hour Concierge team member upon arrival.

We have a 24 hour Concierge team that will be able to assist all our guest with any thing they may need to elevate their stay with us!

A stylish urban neighborhood that borders the Magnificent Mile and is just across the bridge from the Loop, River North is the go-to district for those who appreciate fine art and design. And for those who appreciate fine dining and drinks, the momentum behind the latest trendsetting openings continues to build and the late night energy swells.

We are couple blocks from the Brown line - which takes you easily to the Loop/Merchandise Mart area

And for those who appreciate fine dining and drinks, the momentum behind the latest trendsetting openings continues to build and the late night energy swells.
space: LEVEL Furnished Living combines the style and service of a boutique hotel with the space and comfort of a well-appointed luxury apartment. Located in Downtown Chicago River North. This elegant 25-story tower with one and two bedroom fully furnished suites also boasts over 22,000 sq.ft. of private amenities, including a professionally equipped fitness center, heated outdoor pool and hot tub surrounded by private cabanas, as well as alfresco dining areas, cozy firepits, BBQs, and sauna room. Home to premium tenants including Solidcore, Starbucks and Jimmy Jones, LEVEL Furnished Living is a community unlike any other. Each of the furnished apartments features a fully outfitted kitchen with premium Bosch appliances, ample and contemporary living spaces, floor-to-ceiling windows that overlook open-air balconies; multiple 40-50” flat-screen TVs; personal phone lines and in-suite laundry. And, whether it’s a reservation at a Michelin-starred restaurant or a fridge full of groceries, the LEVEL Concierge Team can make it happen 24-hours a day. Additional services such as parking, weekly housekeeping, and pet-friendly suites are also available.
summary: Take in a view of the best of River North Chicago from the terrace of this modern, well-furnished apartment. Dine in the spacious and ultramodern kitchen, or relax in the elegant, art-filled living room and bedrooms.
transit: We are couple blocks from the Brown line - which takes you easily to the Loop/Merchandise Mart area

access:
This bedroom on 1st floor is used should all rooms fill upstairs!  It is fashioned after a room I stayed in when I visited Paris, France.
On the 1st floor is a bathroom, small art gallery/lounge, an office, and my room in the back. On the lower level- there is an art studio and laundry area. We have a large garden for flowers and relaxing with nature outside.
description:
A Room of Your Own in this Travelers' Residence for Women(4br). See the real Chicago, easy access to public transportation, enjoy meeting other guests. Have a safe, affordable place to hang your hat while staying in Chicago and seeing the sights.



This women's residence in a 113 yr.old 2 story brick house on near west side of Chicago is close to downtown and only 2 short blocks west of the Kedzie stop on the pink line. It is easy to get all over from here! 4 bedrooms!
The place is totally furnished even with linens, dishes,towels, pans, etc. There are 3 bedrooms, a living room, kitchen, bathroom, deck off kitchen on 2nd floor. 

 There is no smoking inside the building. 
We have a very secure building in a residential neighborhood. We have been here for 10 years at this location. I have been renting rooms to women since 1984! Only trustworthy and kind women rent here. Is that you?! 



This bedroom on 1st floor is used should all rooms fill upstairs!  It is fashioned after a room I stayed in when I visited Paris, France.
On the 1st floor is a bathroom, small art gallery/lounge, an office, and my room in the back. On the lower level- there is an art studio and laundry area. We have a large garden for flowers and relaxing with nature outside.

Guests share common rooms on 2nd floor and clean up after themselves. Weekly guests staying longer than one month, share weekly house cleaning chores. Attend periodic house mtg.s
I keep mostly to myself but I am available when people need me. I have 2 dogs named Billy Bob and Wayne who stay with me on 1st floor. We have our quarters in back on 1st floor. They doesn't go to second floor.

Real Chicago neighborhood near public transportation. Lots of families, kids, old folks. Everyone here says hello on the sidewalk as we pass each other.

2 blocks from pink line train stop called Kedzie.
One block from Cermak bus that got to Chinatown!
Can easily go downtown from here!

access:
In addition to your Queen bedroom, there is in-unit laundry, back porch, large kitchen, dining area, 42" TV in living room with basic cable, Netflix and Amazon Prime. 

We'll share the bathroom, living room (my office is also in the living room), kitchen, and back porch. Kitchen is stocked with all the basic appliances you need to cook, a coffee maker, blender, juicer, toaster oven and water filter on tap. Help yourself to several teas to choose from.
description:
Located in a unique Chicago neighborhood, my condo is a great getaway in the city. Close to public transportation to visit downtown or Wrigley Field. Local eats & drinks within walking distance, 50 minutes to downtown via public transportation. 20-30 minute drive to O'Hare airport* or 45 minutes on public transportation. Free street parking. Sunny corner unit with security gate/buzzer system.

Your home-away-from-home is on the SE corner of a 16-unit walk-up vintage condo building on the 2nd floor, so you'll get tons of space and natural light. There is a comfy queen size pillow-top bed in your bedroom with new memory foam pillows, 800 thread-count sheets and luxurious bedding, along with a dresser and empty closet for your use.  There is central A/C & heat, a ceiling fan, large southern exposure window for plenty of natural light, blackout curtains, plus extra linens and pillows in the closet. 

This condo building was gut-rehabbed in 2006 and features hardwood floors, granite counters and stainless steel appliances. My entire unit was professionally repainted in December 2018.

In addition to your Queen bedroom, there is in-unit laundry, back porch, large kitchen, dining area, 42" TV in living room with basic cable, Netflix and Amazon Prime. 

We'll share the bathroom, living room (my office is also in the living room), kitchen, and back porch. Kitchen is stocked with all the basic appliances you need to cook, a coffee maker, blender, juicer, toaster oven and water filter on tap. Help yourself to several teas to choose from.

I'm friendly, outgoing and a great host (If I do say so myself!).  I'll let you do your own thing, but I can offer tips for getting around and things to do in the neighborhood/city if you'd like. I work from home, so I'm in my living room office during the day. I've got a busy social calendar, so I'm usually out at night, but I'm assuming you will be too! You're on your own for food, but the fridge and kitchen are yours to use.

Located in a quiet, tree-lined neighborhood of Irving Park (on the border of Albany Park). Albany Park is one of the most culturally diverse neighborhoods in the U.S. It offers many ethnic restaurants, with acclaimed Mexican, Lebanese and Persian all within walking distance. There are also several watering holes nearby, where you can enjoy local brews and live music. It's very easy to get anywhere in the city from here via CTA bus or L train, and the I-90/94 expressway is nearby. 

In case you run out of anything, there is a CVS, Walgreens and 7-11 within walking distance. Starbucks too!

O'HARE AIRPORT: 20-30* minutes driving/40-50 minutes via transit
MIDWAY AIRPORT: 45-60* minutes driving/1.25-1.5 hours via transit
DOWNTOWN: 25-35* minutes driving/45-50 minutes via transit 
*travel times can be significantly longer during high traffic

The #78 Montrose bus is on the corner of my street. It's a 4 block walk to the Kedzie brown line "L" stop, and a 5 block walk to the #80 Irving Park bus. All 3 are great options to get you to Wrigley Field within 20-30 minutes or downtown/Millennium Park in 45-50 minutes. Also, the Montrose blue line "L" stop is not far if you're coming from O'Hare. Approximately a 30 minute drive to O'Hare or downtown, and a 15 minute drive to Wrigley Field. Uber/Lyft always arrive within 5 minutes. There's a Divvy bike station 4 blocks away on Kedzie/Sunnyside, and it's a quick 20 minute ride to beautiful Montrose beach (or take the #78 bus 3.5 miles east). G00gle maps does a great job of including Chicago public transportation and biking on their routes, but I can definitely help you figure out directions as well. 

Parking on my street is free/not zoned and very easy during the day, however it gets full at night. You may need to drive around the block a couple times until you find a spot, and possibly park a block away. Worst case scenario is to park at the meter spots on Montrose/Spaulding, free overnight between 9pm-8am.

I’ve received comments in the past that the upstairs neighbors walking around can be pretty loud, so if communal space noises are bothersome to you, my unit may not be the one for you. I provide a white noise machine and ear plugs for sensitive sleepers.

access: The entire apartment and back patio is yours, enjoy!
description:
Welcome to our cozy neighborhood oasis! Tucked off a lush, tree lined neighborhood street, our Bungalow is the perfect urban getaway. Stroll two minutes to the heart of Chicago’s Ukrainian Village,  where you can find charming shops, lively bars, and some of the city’s most sought after restaurants. If you want to roam a little further, downtown Chicago is just a 15-minute Uber ride away. Clean, modern, and comfortable – come make our Bungalow your home away from home

The Urban Bungalow is a charming, open concept apartment space in the quiet Ukrainian Village neighborhood of Chicago. Hang on the comfy couches in our living room, where you can play boardgames or watch Netflix on our flat screen TV (Gig speed Internet included). Cook yourself something delicious in our kitchen – it is stocked with all the cookware essentials. And enjoy a warm cup of joe on us at our complimentary coffee bar. If the weather is right, may we recommend you take that dinner or coffee out onto the Bungalow’s large patio space? Hang at the table under our hanging lights, stir up a drink at the outside bar, or recline in one of our hanging hammocks.

2 bedrooms, each with a Queen bed + 1 Queen pull-out Crate & Barrel couch in the living room. Iron and ironing board available for your convenience. Washer and dryer available at no additional cost.

Leave your toiletries behind! We will have all-natural shampoo, conditioner, and body wash ready and waiting for you upon your arrival. Hair dryer, plush towels, and a first-aid kit are available as well. 

Our Bungalow is a pure Chicago oasis. Unwind and relax. Be our guest.

The entire apartment and back patio is yours, enjoy!

We will be available throughout your stay to recommend the wonderful local attractions, dining, nightlife or any other fun things to do while you're in Chicago.

Bask in the youthful, creative energy of West Town. You’ll pass colorful galleries and museums, independent theater companies, small-scale music venues and retail boutiques touting lines from local designers.

The Bungalow is minutes away from some of the cities gratest restaurants and most delicious bars. Enjoy unbelievable French food at Café Mare Jeanne, Live music 7 nights a week at The California Clipper, artisanal coffee and quiet work space at C.C Ferns, and a farm to table dining experience at Rootstock Wine Bar. All mentioned are within a 5 minutes walk from The Bungalow. 

Explore numerous farmers markets (West Humboldt Park, Logan Square, Wicker Park), all just a short bike ride away. Take off for an afternoon of exploring in the city’s most beautiful park, Humboldt Park, which features 207 acres of lakes, gardens, wildlife preserves, bike and running paths, and unobstructed green space.

Explore the neighborhood by taking full advantage of the newly arrived Bird scooters conveniently located at various locations around the neighborhood. Furthermore, find Divvy bikes located within a 5-minute walk from The Bungalow (corner of Cortez and California St.)

PARKING
Complimentary street parking is offered directly in front of The Bungalow. Find your overnight parking pass in the kitchen underneath the coffee maker in the drawer all the way to the left. You will have a separate pass for each night you stay.

GETTING IN
Retrieve the key for your stay located in the lock box to the right of the front door. This key will gain you access to the front door and is not to leave the lock box. The 4 digit code to unlock The Bungalow will be sent to you separately. The Bungalow is the first door on the left as soon as you walk into the building. Please make sure the back-sliding door remains locked when it is not in use.

CHECK-OUT
Please leave the place how you found it. This is our home. Please treat it as such. Feel free to sign the guest-book – tell us your story – share your story with other guests.  

We cannot wait to host you as our guests!

access: Guests have entire apartment to enjoy themselves.
description:
Enjoy an entire apartment only 60 seconds from Wrigley Bleachers - you don't get closer to Wrigley! Conveniently 1 block to Red Line and quick ride to downtown. Walking distance to growing restaurants, shopping, and nightlife. Enjoy spacious, open living room, work-ready desk, and eat-in kitchen!  Sleep well in large bedroom, comfy queen sofa bed, twin cot or air mattress! Central heat & AC. Parking is available on street w/ guest pass - can be tight if you arrive close to a scheduled Cubs game.

Beautiful courtyard building, only steps from Wrigley Bleachers with easy access to unit.
Open kitchen and living space offer a great space to entertain or relax.
Bedroom is spacious with simple peaceful colors.
Enjoy a full kitchen with all appliances and a coffee bar.
The full bathroom comes with necessities and hair dryer.

Guests have entire apartment to enjoy themselves.

I am easily accessible during your stay.

No neighborhood can compare to Wrigleyville!  With the old Wrigley charm combined with brand new restaurants and nightlife,  Wrigleyville has everything you need, but still offers a quick commute downtown.

The Addison Red Line is only one block away.
Parking is available with a guess parking pass.

access: You'll have private access to the two bedroom apartment. There is a shared free laundry room outside the unit on the same level.
description:
Relax at your home away from home on a quiet street in Chicago's Logan Square/Avondale neighborhood! This is a completely finished apartment in a three unit building. The space has two bedrooms living and dining areas plus a full kitchen. There is also *central air* and heat plus wifi. The unit has a private entrance and through the back is free laundry that is shared with permanent residents. The TV has Netflix and Hulu access.

A block north is the CTA 56 Bus which will take you to the blue line towards downtown or O'hare Airport and all the hot spots along Chicago's "hipster highway". A block south you'll find a great independent coffee and sandwich shop lining Logan Square's largest park. A full grocery story is within a ten minute walk. 

Please keep all gates closed since there are dogs living in the other units.

You'll have private access to the two bedroom apartment. There is a shared free laundry room outside the unit on the same level.

The host lives in a separate apartment within the building and is very knowledgeable of the city and neighborhood.

This BnB is on the border of popular Logan Square and Avondale. Check out some of the neighborhoods michelin star awarded restaurants and thriving nightlife.  During the summer stop by the large Logan Square Farmer's Market Sunday mornings or use the ample public transit to explore the city

This BnB is accessible via the CTA Blue Line that runs directly from O'hare airport to downtown. From the Logan Square station you can connect to a 56 Milwaukee or 76 Diversey bus which will connect you within a block (5min walk) of the unit.  The unit is also right off Interstate 90 (Kennedy Expressway).

additional_house_rules:
Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking:

-No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250).
-If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair.
- The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred.
-Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am.
-Lost key fee - $300
-Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc.
-Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc.
-Smoking - $300
-Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300

access: No need to be shy about making yourself at home in this swanky Chi-Town apartment; our place is yours and only yours during your stay. We do ask that you respect our neighbors by keeping noise to a reasonable level.
description:
Welcome to Chicago! Home of World Series Champs Cubs. Our 2-bedroom/1 bathroom condo is perfect for getaway to Chicago. It's professionally designed with modern furniture that gives welcome feeling! We're located in Trendy Logan Square

Designated parking spot is NOT available, but there is plenty of street parking available.

Illuminated by sunny natural light, our apartment features two Queen-size beds, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units.

The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower!

There’s ample space for guests to relax on the sofa and watch on a large flat-screen TV. Like the rest of the unit, you’ll live it up in luxury among hardwood floors and contemporary decor. The entire place has free, fast WiFi and Chicago sunshine streaming in through the windows.

Whether you’re craving a home-cooked meal or just somewhere to put the box of deep-dish, our kitchen is fully stocked with cookware, dishes, utensils, and has swanky granite countertops. Appliances include a full-sized fridge and freezer, gas stove, oven, microwave, toaster, and coffee maker. The only things missing are your favorite farmer’s market finds!!

No need to be shy about making yourself at home in this swanky Chi-Town apartment; our place is yours and only yours during your stay. We do ask that you respect our neighbors by keeping noise to a reasonable level.

We are available by phone throughout your stay. You can simply call or text if you have any questions.

Logan Square is one of the city's vibrant neighborhoods, balancing family-friendly activities and a thriving community of Chicago's aspiring artists, musicians independent spirited folks. The vintage charm of Logan Theater hosts the annual Chicago Underground Film Festival for those cinephiles. It is also the home of the historical Illinois Centennial Memorial that commemorates Illinois statehood designed by the same architect who created the Lincoln Memorial in Washington DC.restored arcade machines.
Make your afternoon stroll or even a bike tour at Humboldt Park and Logan Square , as the community is graced with tree line boulevard and parks.
After the strolling, satisfy your taste buds in Logan Square's top dining destinations. A "must try" is a visit to Dos Urban Cantina, Diana Dávila's authentic Mexican fare at Mi Tocaya Antojería to Abe Conlon's Macanese-influenced menu at Fat Rice and make that reservation ASAP at GIANT, Nightwood chef Jason Vincent's Logan Square restaurant. Of course for that sweet treats, head over to Logan's famous rotating ice cream shop – Pretty Cool Ice Cream and make sure to line up at Bang Bang Pie and Biscuits. And when you feel like drinking, there's plenty of cocktail bars and pubs for the night crowd that you don't want to miss having a few of your favorite games at Emporium Arcade Bar, the neighborhood's popular destination of restored arcade machines.
Truly you don't want to miss out Logan Square's appeal of fancy restaurants, nightlife, specialty stores and fab finds at farmers markets, parks, arcade bars, galleries and theaters.

This area is very walkable — most errands can be accomplished on foot. Transit is good, with many nearby public transportation options. The best way to get around is with the CTA train and Bus. You can Uber/Lyft.  It's convenient to use a bike for most trips.

-Please be aware If you lose the key and entry fob, which is your access to the entire building, it cannot be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment unit and all amenities until another one can be made. There is a $300 fee for losing key and entry fob.

-All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay, as they are other tenants at the property.

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay

-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.

-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).

-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 

-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.
house_rules:
Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking:

-No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250).
-If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair.
- The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred.
-Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am.
-Lost key fee - $300
-Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc.
-Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc.
-Smoking - $300
-Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300

description:
Welcome to my 3-story historic landmark Evanston home w/3 rooms to choose from 2.5 blocks from CTA and 5 blocks from Metra. Ideal for Northwestern Univ - related business or family affairs w/multi-room needs.  Self-serve breakfast included. Use dining, living rooms, backyard, board games, tons of books. Wifi is strong anywhere in the house. Close to Downtown Evanston, 80+ restaurants, Union Pizzeria & Space for musical acts and good eats at Hewn artisan bakery. 15-minute walk to Lake Michigan.

The 3-story home is one unit of a landmarked Holabird and Roche row-house built in 1892  located in a quiet, tree-filled neighborhood full of beautiful historic churches and homes. 
This room is on the third floor with private bath and will have a king-size bed with both seating and work areas. 
Out of respect for our neighbors and other guests, we lock the door at 11:30p unless special arrangements have been made in advance.
Dogs are fine with prior discussion, NO cats allowed due to allergies.

I am around most of the time and available to my guests at all times by phone or messaging. I enjoy chatting with guests, yet realize that it is unlikely that they came to stay to visit with me :-).
As a life-long resident of the area, I am happy to share my knowledge and to give recommendations.

Home is on a quiet, tree-lined street with a park just a block away. Many other historic homes and churches within walking distance. Lake Michigan is just 3/4 mile away with beaches, parks, and biking and walking paths. There are Trader Joes and Jewel/Osco stores approximately 1/4 mile from the house as is Hewn, an artisan bakery that guests rave about. Many fine restaurants  and unique boutiques are within walking distance. Approximately 1.25 miles from Northwestern University.

You can get to anywhere around Evanston and the city of Chicago from the Dempster Street purple line (2.5 blocks)and Davis Metra (5 blocks) stops which are within easy walking distance. Evanston has over 80 restaurants covering almost any ethnic food you could desire.

The bus route 250 which travels to and from O’Hare airport has a stop at the Davis St. (5 blocks). Ample free street parking is available on the blocks surrounding the house.

access: Guests can use the private space of the entire studio as well and common building areas, including the fitness center.
description:
A two bedroom apartment surrounded by good restaurants & bars, stores, grocery stores, pharmacies, salons and spas, it doesn't get better than this! Downtown!
Great location for business visits or travels with your family and friends.
You can visit the most famous city attractions by walking, they are very close from apartment: Millennium Park, Cloud Gate, Loop, Magnificent Mile, Skydeck (all between 7 and 18 minutes walking distance).

The space is great whether you’re traveling solo, with your family and friends, for business or as a couple. Everything is provided for your convenience.
The 2 bedroom apartment features an open living room and kitchen space. The kitchen has modern appliances, like microwave, dishwasher, toaster, tea kettle and a coffee maker. It also includes utensils: plates, cups, glasses and cooking pots. 
The living room includes a big TV with Netflix and a comfortable sofa.
The bedrooms features a king sized bed/queen size bed and closets. Unit offers blankets, pillows and bed linens.
Bathrooms has bathtub showers and essential amenities included: hair dryer, body soap, shampoo and extra large towels.

- Wi-Fi high-speed internet, air conditioning and heating can be found in all property.

Guests can use the private space of the entire studio as well and common building areas, including the fitness center.

Should you need help with anything - instructions on how to use an appliance, transportation info or restaurant & sightseeing recommendations? Please let us know. You can always contact us via airbnb messaging. We're always happy to help!

If you do not want to cook, there are a lot of restaurants nearby the apartment, for all tastes.

In this space pets are NOT permitted, and not even smokers. 
If you need an extra bed, please inform us and we will provide.
interaction: Should you need help with anything - instructions on how to use an appliance, transportation info or restaurant & sightseeing recommendations? Please let us know. You can always contact us via airbnb messaging. We're always happy to help!
neighborhood_overview: If you do not want to cook, there are a lot of restaurants nearby the apartment, for all tastes.
notes:
In this space pets are NOT permitted, and not even smokers. 
If you need an extra bed, please inform us and we will provide.
space:
The space is great whether you’re traveling solo, with your family and friends, for business or as a couple. Everything is provided for your convenience.
The 2 bedroom apartment features an open living room and kitchen space. The kitchen has modern appliances, like microwave, dishwasher, toaster, tea kettle and a coffee maker. It also includes utensils: plates, cups, glasses and cooking pots. 
The living room includes a big TV with Netflix and a comfortable sofa.
The bedrooms features a king sized bed/queen size bed and closets. Unit offers blankets, pillows and bed linens.
Bathrooms has bathtub showers and essential amenities included: hair dryer, body soap, shampoo and extra large towels.

- Wi-Fi high-speed internet, air conditioning and heating can be found in all property.
summary:
A two bedroom apartment surrounded by good restaurants & bars, stores, grocery stores, pharmacies, salons and spas, it doesn't get better than this! Downtown!
Great location for business visits or travels with your family and friends.
You can visit the most famous city attractions by walking, they are very close from apartment: Millennium Park, Cloud Gate, Loop, Magnificent Mile, Skydeck (all between 7 and 18 minutes walking distance).

access: You have access to two bedrooms, your own bathroom, kitchen and dining space.
description:
This is a beautiful and cozy private unit located on the garden floor with two bedrooms and a queen futon. This Airbnb can sleep up to 6 people comfortably. Equipped with a large bathroom, in unit washer & dryer, and kitchen for your comfort. We also provide clean and fresh towels, shampoo and refreshments. Located in the heart of Chinatown, a brisk walk from McCormick place & a quick train from downtown Chicago. Book your Airbnb with us today!

This space is perfect for 1 person wanting privacy or up to 6 if you want to make it a party! We just ask that you don't smoke indoors :) and respect our neighbors. There's free street parking but we also offer private garage parking for an additional fee.

You have access to two bedrooms, your own bathroom, kitchen and dining space.

Chinatown is safe & quiet. We're in the residential area but are a quick walk to plenty of delicious and inexpensive restaurants! We're about a 2min walk to the nearest public bus that can take you downtown and about a 7min walk from the nearest red line.

5-8 minute walk to Chinatown red line stop,  our place is less than 2 miles from McCormick center (about a 20 min walk, 12 min by bus, or a 4 min cab ride). If you have any other questions, please let me know.

No pets and no smoking allowed indoors.
