access:
Guests will need to walk down the driveway to the back of the property and enter through a door between the garages. Take the flight of stairs up to the coach house door. 
We will have a lockbox on the door and will give guests the code, prior to their arrival.
There is a parking spot outside the garage for one car.
description:
This cozy coach house, nicknamed Linden Place
is on the grounds of an Historic 1909 Prairie-Style House in Oak Park. Nestled among the trees you will find a quiet studio apartment with a private entrance, full kitchen, sitting room, and bath. There is a sleeper sofa for an extra guest.  Let us know if you would like to enjoy the fire pit or use the charcoal grill.

Built in 1925, this coach house was originally the quarters for the chauffeur and cook for the main house. There was an intercom system at the bottom of the stairs to communicate with the owner, Mr. Cronwall.
We renovated the space in 2011 for our own guests and now have expanded to Airbnb. There is a very efficient Fujitsu split system for heating and cooling that uses a remote control. A Keurig coffee maker is on hand for that first cup of Joe before you head out for the day.

Guests will need to walk down the driveway to the back of the property and enter through a door between the garages. Take the flight of stairs up to the coach house door. 
We will have a lockbox on the door and will give guests the code, prior to their arrival.
There is a parking spot outside the garage for one car.

This is a seperate building with its own entrance. We are  often available when guests arrive and love meeting new people and hearing of your traveling adventures. We are happy to offer advice on things to do and see in Oak Park/Chicago.

Located in the Frank Lloyd Wright Historic District you will find stunning architectural treasures all around you.  You will be close to shopping and many restaurants, including Hemingway's Bistro and of course, the Frank Lloyd Wright Home and Studio.

One off street parking space will be available for our guests. The house is located within walking distance of the Green Line to downtown Chicago as well as the Metra Station. 
A quick Uber ride will get you into Chicago for endless entertainment possibilities. There are bike rentals available in town and several guided tours.

description:
This... is a great place to stay for a true Chicago experience!

This cozy, 2 bedroom apartment is fully stocked with everything you need to make yourself at home! Living and dining area feature a sectional and dining room table for relaxing or getting work done. Bedrooms feature pillow top king and queen mattresses for some of the best sleep of your life! I promise you this. I own the same mattresses. 

Regardless to the reason for your visit, this space is perfect for whatever you‘re here for!

The entire unit, including a reasonable portion of the back porch, are available for you to use.

I live in the neighborhood and I love it! I totally don’t mind hanging out or socializing, but I also completely respect your privacy. I can be as involved as you do or don’t want me to be, but generally, I’ll leave you alone unless you need something or ask me specifically to be involved with your stay.

The location is one of the central features of this property! Depending on how comfortable you are with urban scenery, you can walk, but a car is suggested. The unit is centrally located between two main Chicago expressways — I-94 (the Dan Ryan) and Lake Shore Drive. In addition, you are well within walking distance to two Green Line stations, which makes getting to downtown in 20 minutes a breeze. There is a brand new full service grocery store (complete with liquor section) that’s a 2 minute drive, 7 minute walk located nearby. University of Chicago/UCHICAGO Medicine campus is a 10-12 minute walk, 4 minute drive. President Obama’s Chicago home is a 10 minute drive. The beach is a 5 minute drive. 

While I truly believe that the central location here is one of the best features of the unit... and while I love and live comfortably in this neighborhood, I don’t want to mislead anyone who is not super comfortable with urban living. If you’re not from or have familiarity with a major urban city, you might be in for a little bit or a culture shock.

I would definitely SUGGEST a car, but you absolutely do NOT need one. You can easily move about the city within a 10-30 minute window by walking, taking the bus, or taking the train from this location.

We ask the following of our guests:

~ Please treat our home with respect.

~ Guests may not smoke on the property.

~ Pets are not allowed.

~ We ask that guests do not bring others who are not listed by name on the Airbnb Agreement (I.e., visitors), into our home, without our prior approval.

~ We ask that you remove your shoes inside our home, to help us maintain a clean environment. Slippers are provided for your use, to ensure your comfort!

~  Do not engage in illegal activities while on our property.

~ Return all keys at end of visit.

access:
Guests will have access to the kitchen, dining and living rooms. The entire house was renovated - down to the studs - in 2015, and the kitchen is large and bright, and guests are welcome to use our refrigerator as needed. Guests are also welcome to use our microwave. We will provide coffee, tea, and set out simple breakfast choices in the morning.

Guests also have access to our upstairs workout room, which has a gym-quality Precor elliptical machine, as well as two yoga mats. If requested, you may also use our weight bench, and graduated Boflex weights, after a short tutorial.

Should you be traveling with smaller children, we have a full playroom with an art table and plenty of toys and dress-up items that your children are welcome to use.

We also have a spacious, quiet backyard for guests' use! In the summer, we have a dining table and chairs set up for outdoor meals or coffee (the table seats six adults). We also have plenty of outdoor toys, balls, and ride-on vehicles for children.

Guests have access to our Wi-Fi as well.

Should you need travel cribs, air mattresses, or a stroller, we are happy to provide them. We have a pack-and-play, a toddler mattress, several twin air mattresses, and a stroller - all available for your use. 

Finally, parking in front of the house is easy and free.
description:
We offer a private bedroom and private full bath in our newly-renovated, 100-year-old home, on a quiet, residential street in charming Evanston! The bedroom sleeps two (or two adults and one child in a travel crib) and is attached via a private hallway to its own bath.

Our private room and full bath are situated off of a short private hallway on the first floor of the house. The hallway can be closed off from the rest of the floor. The room houses a cozy, comfortable full-sized bed that sleeps two adults, a full closet for your use, and extra pillows and blankets galore! A deep plum wall color, mahogany antique furniture, and artwork give the room a homey yet elegant feel. 

The bathroom features a full bathtub, with shower, and a vanity for any storage needs. We will provide plenty of soft, cozy towels for you.

We welcome children, and have a pack-and-play, and toddler or twin-sized air mattresses for your use. A travel crib or small air mattress fits next to the bed.

Guests will have access to the kitchen, dining and living rooms. The entire house was renovated - down to the studs - in 2015, and the kitchen is large and bright, and guests are welcome to use our refrigerator as needed. Guests are also welcome to use our microwave. We will provide coffee, tea, and set out simple breakfast choices in the morning.

Guests also have access to our upstairs workout room, which has a gym-quality Precor elliptical machine, as well as two yoga mats. If requested, you may also use our weight bench, and graduated Boflex weights, after a short tutorial.

Should you be traveling with smaller children, we have a full playroom with an art table and plenty of toys and dress-up items that your children are welcome to use.

We also have a spacious, quiet backyard for guests' use! In the summer, we have a dining table and chairs set up for outdoor meals or coffee (the table seats six adults). We also have plenty of outdoor toys, balls, and ride-on vehicles for children.

Guests have access to our Wi-Fi as well.

Should you need travel cribs, air mattresses, or a stroller, we are happy to provide them. We have a pack-and-play, a toddler mattress, several twin air mattresses, and a stroller - all available for your use. 

Finally, parking in front of the house is easy and free.

We will absolutely respect your needs when it comes to socializing with us. We are happy to leave you to your private time, and we also love to spend time with new people! Whatever your wish is for privacy, we will respect it. We are also happy to help with tips, suggestions and recommendations about things to do in Evanston and Chicago. 

We do have two children, ages five and seven, and I am home with them at different times during the day. We will not intrude on your private time. The children wake at 8am and go to bed at 7:30 pm, so there is always plenty of quiet, adult-only time around the house. Typically, the children are away from home from 9am until 12pm, and then often again in the afternoon.

Our house is located on a quiet, lovely, residential street, and is only a ten-minute walk to downtown Evanston, with its fantastic restaurants and shops! Guests can walk to bakeries, coffee shops, bars, restaurants, and several grocery stores (including Trader Joe's). We are also a twenty-minute walk from the lake, with its stunning lake shore path, beaches, parks and picnic areas! Take a leisurely bike ride, walk or run along the path, or take a swim in the lake in the summer. Visit the storied and beautiful Northwestern Campus, or grab a train or drive to downtown Chicago for shopping and sightseeing! You can walk to the Metra commuter train from our house, which takes you into Downtown Chicago in less than 30 minutes. You can also board the Purple Line, part of the Chicago Transit Authority's system of elevated trains, at the same location. It will also take you into Chicago. Or, it is an easy drive to downtown Chicago from our house. You will love Evanston and all it has to offer, as well as its proximity and easy access to Chicago!

LOCAL INFORMATION:

This location is Very Walkable so most errands can be accomplished on foot.

Nearby parks include Boltwood Park, Robert Crown Park and Larimer Park.

You can walk to the Metra or CTA from our house (about a twenty-minute walk). Alternately, you can hop on a bus at the end of our street, which takes you to the trains in about two minutes!

Please note that we have a small, gentle, friendly dog. He does not bark (yes, seriously!), and is not allowed in the guest area. He is wonderful with all people, including small children.
house_rules:
We ask the following of our guests:

~ Please treat our home with respect.

~ Guests may not smoke on the property.

~ Pets are not allowed.

~ We ask that guests do not bring others who are not listed by name on the Airbnb Agreement (I.e., visitors), into our home, without our prior approval.

~ We ask that you remove your shoes inside our home, to help us maintain a clean environment. Slippers are provided for your use, to ensure your comfort!

~  Do not engage in illegal activities while on our property.

~ Return all keys at end of visit.
interaction:
We will absolutely respect your needs when it comes to socializing with us. We are happy to leave you to your private time, and we also love to spend time with new people! Whatever your wish is for privacy, we will respect it. We are also happy to help with tips, suggestions and recommendations about things to do in Evanston and Chicago. 

We do have two children, ages five and seven, and I am home with them at different times during the day. We will not intrude on your private time. The children wake at 8am and go to bed at 7:30 pm, so there is always plenty of quiet, adult-only time around the house. Typically, the children are away from home from 9am until 12pm, and then often again in the afternoon.

space:
Our private room and full bath are situated off of a short private hallway on the first floor of the house. The hallway can be closed off from the rest of the floor. The room houses a cozy, comfortable full-sized bed that sleeps two adults, a full closet for your use, and extra pillows and blankets galore! A deep plum wall color, mahogany antique furniture, and artwork give the room a homey yet elegant feel. 

The bathroom features a full bathtub, with shower, and a vanity for any storage needs. We will provide plenty of soft, cozy towels for you.

We welcome children, and have a pack-and-play, and toddler or twin-sized air mattresses for your use. A travel crib or small air mattress fits next to the bed.
summary: We offer a private bedroom and private full bath in our newly-renovated, 100-year-old home, on a quiet, residential street in charming Evanston! The bedroom sleeps two (or two adults and one child in a travel crib) and is attached via a private hallway to its own bath.
transit: You can walk to the Metra or CTA from our house (about a twenty-minute walk). Alternately, you can hop on a bus at the end of our street, which takes you to the trains in about two minutes!

access: You will have full access to the second floor space.
description:
Welcome to our home! This airy, light filled second floor apartment awaits. Custom artwork and an eclectic vibe fill the walls of the dining, living room and bedroom spaces. Off the main living area enjoy a birds eye view on the front balcony  while you enjoy your morning cup or evening cocktail. We are two blocks from the Belmont blue line station, easily get to downtown, Wrigley Field, O’Hare. Steps from our vibrant neighborhood hub. Everything you need within walking distance!

In Spring, Summer & Fall months, plants and flowers surround our home. Your second floor unit opens into the dining area. To the right, multiple living areas with sliding glass doors open to the front balcony, complete with bistro table and chairs. To the left, the kitchen boasts new appliances and a laptop ready workspace. The bedrooms are furnished with new mattresses, mattress covers, lush bedding and pillows. The back laundry is equipped with an LG wave Washer & Dryer. Like a hotel, everything is provided.
-Laundry & dishwasher  detergent 
-coffee, tea, sugar & sweeteners 
-hairdryer, iron, ironing board, soap, shampoo, lotion, fluffy towels.
-filtered water
-2 umbrellas
-Fully stocked kitchen with blender, coffee maker, all kitchen utensils, plates, glasses, etc.
-fire extinguisher 
-first aid kit
-tv, Netflix, cable, DVD's
-yoga mat

You will have full access to the second floor space.

I work from my home, live in the first floor unit and am available as your host as little or as much as you would like. A Guest book will be on the dining room table answering many questions you may have about the space, local eateries, breweries, shopping and site seeing, but of course, I am completely accessible to help out with any additional questions.

Avondale is known for its low key artistic vibe. It is a vibrant neighborhood and we are located in its heart, making it easy for you 
to enjoy the many restaurants and shops within walking distance.
For foodies, Michelin starred Parachute Restaurant (Korean) is nearby- just past Revolution tap room, where you may stop for a pint on your way to dinner. Within a 5-10 minute walk-Fat Rice (SE Asian)cuisine, Friendship Chinese, JAM (brunch), Cafe con Leche, Reno(wood fired pizza), Cellar Door Provisions (farm to table) amongst many other restaurants detailed in the Guest Book.
To catch a movie take a five minute 
walk to The Logan Theater, our neighborhoods vintage theater with full bar and lounge.
Grab a few cocktails at nearby waterholes like Lost Lake to get your tiki on, Longman  & Eagle for an extended whiskey selection or Masa Azul which has a huge artisanel tequila menu.
Nearby grocery stores include Aldi and The Dill Pickle Co-Op.
Wrigley by car is a 10-15 car/Uber ride. The blue line is 2 blocks away and it is a 15 minute train ride to the downtown Loop.

We are centrally located between two blue line train stops, Belmont-which is two blocks NW and Logan Square-which is 5 blocks SE. The 
blue line train will get you to Chicagos loop in about 20 minutes. Chicago has great bus 
transportation as well, buses run about every 10-12 minutes. Ventra tickets are used to ride both the train & bus. You can purchase your Ventra Card at any train station. The Ventra App allows you to add 
money to your card and track public transportation in real time. 
Uber, Lift, and cab drivers are never more than 5 minutes away.
Divvy bike share locations are 
throughout Chicago, the closest
 are at the Belmont blue line stop, just 2 blocks away. If you are driving, we are less than one quarter mile to the Kennedy 90/94 expressway.

You are welcome to customize your stay. The house can be stocked and ready with groceries and other specific needs of our guests. Additional charges apply.

additional_house_rules:
- You agree to the following:
- 
- CHECK-IN: is on or after 5 PM unless otherwise agreed to in writing as our cleaning staff needs sufficient time to prepare. Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing 
- KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB
- BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you 
- QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. Any additional occupants in excess of the # on your reservation must be approved by me whether in your unit or in common areas. Any damage from you or your guests will result in immediate expulsion, at an additional cost to you, a claim with Airbnb and subsequent legal action 
- SMOKING: whether inside your unit, in a common area or roof deck, no smoking of any substance is allowed. Smoke damage to a unit will result in a $1000 fee
- PETS: you understand pets are not allowed in your unit. Pet damage may result in additional fees
- MISSING ITEMS: will be charged to you in a claim 
- ID CHECK: per the rules of this community, we'll request you submit your Government Issued Photo ID at the time of your e-check in via our site. You'll have to also agree to our terms of service. We're required to do a public records check for certain communities
- BREACH: any violation of the above shall result in immediate removal from the property at an additional cost to you
- BOOKING WITHIN 24 HRS: We'll send a request for a $500-1000 deposit which shall be fully returned on checkout

description:
Gorgeous 2BD/2BA Unit in the heart of Chicago - Magnificent Mile. Professionally managed and cleaned with stylish kitchen, free high-speed wifi and 24/7 support. Fully stocked with all the convenience you would expect at a hotel.

We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week

Located in one of Chicago's lakefront neighborhoods. This apartment is ideal for those who want to have the best of both worlds. City living at it's finest with the best dining and shopping places and just a few minutes away is Oak Street Beach which is a great place for water sports and biking. Enjoy its warm red brick exterior that highlights the rich history that this apartment is known for. Floor to ceiling windows provides the open concept living/dining room apartment a lot of natural light. All units are furnished and provided flat screen TV's, free fast wifi service, kitchenware/cookware and bathroom amenities. Our amazing customer support team are always available to attend to your needs.

We offer rewards and complimentary upgrades to our regular repeat guests

access: Other than my bedroom all other spaces are available (living room, kitchen, bathroom) also have a back porch to go out to have coffee or smoke
description:
My space is very accessible to public transportation ( walking distance to 3 bus lines) also a neighborhood grocery store 1 Blk away ( for essentials & alcohol & ATM) for eating establishment also close corner block has a French restaurant (Jean-Marie) , bakery (Spinning J) , Bar restaurant (Rootstock Wine & Beer) and Pizza bar (Dante’s ) great breakfast diner “Flying Saucer”

Other than my bedroom all other spaces are available (living room, kitchen, bathroom) also have a back porch to go out to have coffee or smoke

Since  I live in the space also & am available to any questions you may have

Built around one of Chicago’s best parks, Humboldt Park is home to great bars, restaurants, shops and more. Known for its large Puerto Rican population and the lovely green space from which it’s name is derived, Humboldt Park is a West Side neighborhood with no shortage of attractions.

If you are driving into town public parking is available on my street the only thing there is a school across street (Chi Arts Academy) & during school days you cannot park on that side from 7:30am to 5:30pm all other blocks east & west are free
interaction: Since  I live in the space also & am available to any questions you may have

additional_house_rules:
Pretty Simple Rules apply:
1) This is absolutely no smoking unit. 

2) Because of the nature of the building and the residents that live here, there are no parties/events to be held, and the noise level should be respectable to others. Please keep quiet especially after 10pm.

3) If you break something we expect you to fix it or replace it.

4) No unregistered guests allowed for overnight stays

5) If you use any of the pantry items please replace them upon your departure.

6) Parking in park spot #1 ONLY with the permit when requested.

7) For monthly stays or longer extra cleaning charges may apply( tbd with guest)

access:
The entire apartment is for your use.  
Sling TV Cable, Wireless Internet, DVD Player.
description:
The place: 
- One bedroom apartment located on second floor. Elevator in building. 
- Comes with included parking spot in covered garage under the building.   
- The condo is located on a quiet side street, one block away from the beach. 5 min walk to CTA train, and 3 min walk to bus stop which will both take you downtown in about 25 min
- Whole-foods, Starbucks, Thai, Chinese and other restaurants within walking distance.

Modern condo which is best suited for a couple or friends traveling together. The bedroom has one queen size bed and the front room has a leather couch( not a pull out) The kitchen is fully stocked, the bathroom will provide towels, shampoo, conditioner, soap and toilet paper. 

Sling TV  Cable means basic channels but who wants to watch TV when on vacation anyway? :)  Wireless Internet, DVD Player. 

I may not be present during your stay but I will assure you have all the information you need on the table and also leave you my number should you have any questions.  

Everything is close by: LA Fitness Gym, Cleaners, Liqueur Store, 2 Parks for Children, Beach, Train, Bus, Whole Foods, Mariano's(5 min by car), Sushi, Thai, Jimmy Jones, CVS, Walgreen's are all within walking distance.   

5 min away from CTA red line train
3 min away from CTA (phone number hidden) buses which can take you all to downtown.
Central A/C controlled by thermostat located in the living room. 

Parking - please be mindful of Chicago spaces... this is an under building garage spot offered FREE however if you are not comfortable backing into the spot or used to tight spaces this may not be suitable for you if you are traveling in a larger SUVs or PickUp truck.  If you have a larger vehicle please use Spot Hero to find better suited larger spot.

The entire apartment is for your use.  
Sling TV Cable, Wireless Internet, DVD Player.

I may not be present during your stay but I will assure you have all the information you need on the table and also leave you my number should you have any questions.

Edgewater, as the name would imply, hugs the shores of Lake Michigan some seven miles north of downtown Chicago. Famous for its expansive beaches and sprawling park space, this neighborhood boasts an eclectic mix of urban gains and natural beauty. When strolling through Edgewater, expect to find families, a crowd of illustrious city landmarks and some of the Midwest's best antique shopping.

The apartment is located 5 min walking distance from Red Line CTA station and 3 min walking distance from bus station. Uber and Lyft are also available.

1) The unit does not have washer/dryer. The washer is $1 and the dryer is free but they are located on the lower level of the building. My unit is on second floor. 


2) Should you need to use of parking spot, it requires a daily permit to be replaced in the car every 24 hours. If the permit is not there, the car might be towed and it will be at your own expense. Will you need parking spot? Please let me know when sending inquiries.

3) For long term reservations of 3 weeks or more guest is responsible for entire monthly electric &  gas  bills which depending on the usage usually are about $100/mo combined. This will be requested as extra service charge at the end of stay.

4) This is an older building in historic district so the hardwood floors might be a bit squeaky. It just adds to the charm of the area and its eclectic beauty ;)
house_rules:
Pretty Simple Rules apply:
1) This is absolutely no smoking unit. 

2) Because of the nature of the building and the residents that live here, there are no parties/events to be held, and the noise level should be respectable to others. Please keep quiet especially after 10pm.

3) If you break something we expect you to fix it or replace it.

4) No unregistered guests allowed for overnight stays

5) If you use any of the pantry items please replace them upon your departure.

6) Parking in park spot #1 ONLY with the permit when requested.

7) For monthly stays or longer extra cleaning charges may apply( tbd with guest)
interaction: I may not be present during your stay but I will assure you have all the information you need on the table and also leave you my number should you have any questions.

access:
Once your booking is confirmed you will receive check in instructions before arrival in your itinerary.

Nearby lockboxes with keys allow convenient check-in.
In & out driveway access for guests who purchase parking.
description:
Be close to all of the action in Chicago’s Lakeview neighborhood! You will be steps from Boystown, Wrigleyville, Lake Michigan, Belmont Theater District, Addison Station, Belmont Station, and much more.  Nightlife, retail shopping, coffee shops, and liquor stores all walking distance.

This home is an excellent location for people eager to visit one of the most diverse, cultured, and popular late-night neighborhoods in Chicago.

Reliable and effortless check-in as the apartment is equipped with a lockbox. The apartment occupies the second floor of a historic Chicago building - as you walk up the private stairwell, you'll enter the kitchen which opens into the airy living room, to the left you'll see the large dining area. Down the hall to the right are the three bedrooms and two bathrooms and through the back door is the back porch.

You will love my home because of the A+ location, amenities, and accessibility with a bus Stop right outside of the front door, Divvy Bike station directly across the street, and Belmont or Addison Red Line stops within 10 minutes walking distance. 

Great for families, couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and groups.

This 2nd floor property is beautifully located in the heart of Boystown’s historic nightlife. This property is perfect for entertaining because of its open layout. You will also have access to the bar (provide your own booze), board games, and beer pong. (During summer months) guests will also have access to the back porch.

During your stay you will have access to Internet, in-unit Washer/Dryer, and reserved easy in & out driveway parking available for purchase so you don’t have to worry about checking on your car throughout your visit. (additional cars/guests can buy street parking passes from me as well.)

If you have a little one there is a pack & play available if needed.

You will love this beautiful private space that is designed to make guests feel at home with an emphasis on community and occupation of common spaces. 

Central Air Conditioning and Heat
In-unit Washer/Dryer
Dining space for 6 at the table and 2 more at the bar stool. 

3 Queen Beds, 1 Sleeper Sofa, 2 Bathrooms, WiFi, 3 TV’s (bring your own programming), Bluetooth speaker, Towels and Linens, Coffee, Equipped Kitchen, 2 Blow dryers, Let me know if there is anything specific you may need before or during your trip and I will do my best to accommodate! 

Your safety and security is priority -- the entry codes are generated for you during your stay and no previous guests can access the apartment after they check out.

Boystown Bars = Seconds away
Wrigley Field = 9 minute walk 
Addison Station = 9 minute walk
Belmont Station = 10 minute walk
Belmont Harbor = 16 minute walk

Magnificent Mile = 11+ minute car ride (depending on traffic)
Soldier Field = 15+ minute car ride (depending on traffic)
DePaul University Lincoln Park = 10 minute car ride (35 minute walk)
Aragon Ballroom = 10 minute car ride
Lincoln Park Zoo = 10 minute car ride (35 minute walk)
Millennium Park = 14+ minute car ride (depending on traffic)
United Center = 23+ minute car ride (depending on traffic)
Field Museum & Shedd Aquarium = 19+ minute car ride (depending on traffic)

Once your booking is confirmed you will receive check in instructions before arrival in your itinerary.

Nearby lockboxes with keys allow convenient check-in.
In & out driveway access for guests who purchase parking.

Right in Boystown, Wrigleyville, Lakeview, Belmont Harbor, Wrigley Field, Belmont and Addison L stations, Lakefront, Lake Michigan, Lincoln Park, SouthPort, and Andersonville. 

Located In a lively entertainment district that is surrounded by restaurants and bars. Bars close at 2:00am and 3:00 am Saturdays. 

Spacious apartment with great views and a great location.

Great place for Cub’s games, Pride, Market Days, Lollapalooza, St. Patrick's, and Chicago Marathon. You will literally be able to watch the pride parade, pride festival, and Market Days festival from the living room.

CTA Bus stop is outside of the front door.
Addison Station = 9 minute walk
Belmont Station = 10 minute walk
Divvy Bike station directly across the street.
Belmont Harbor = 16 minute walk

Please inquire about any questions regarding minimum and maximum length bookings, I am open to working on durations!

Lock-Out Service is not guaranteed.

description:
1 bedroom apartment

This place is located in the Chatham area. It is a cozy 1 bedroom unit inside of a 4 unit building.

Guests are only allowed access to the apartment. Guests should not roam the building or enter other apartments or areas.

I am available at any time during your entire stay.

This is not a tourist spot! This is in the heart of the city.

Free street parking is available. CTA is within walking distance.

The oven in this unit is not working, but the stove top does.

Guest should not smoke inside the building. There will be an additional fee for smoking. 

Guests must return keys to the host. There will be an additional fee to hire a locksmith if keys are not returned to host.

access: Guests have complete access to our modern, fully-equipped kitchen so long as it's kept clean after each use.
description:
The McCormick Place Experience by DivvyTrek is a private guest room in a modern condo one-half block to the CTA Green Line stop that’s 20 minutes to McCormick Place Convention Center. 

The Art Institute, Museum Park, Mag Mile and Millennium Park are minutes away by train. 

Lakefront, beaches, stadiums, Hyde Park, University of Chicago, IIT, UIC and Loop campuses are nearby.

We offer a bedroom in a condo located in a hip, up-and-coming area near the Chicago Loop with parking, WiFi and washer/dryer access.

Enjoy the privacy/comfort of your own bedroom, a fully-equipped modern kitchen and full access to the dining/living rooms. Long-term stays are available. 

There'll be guests staying at our place during your stay which is great for meeting new people and networking. Essentially, we offer the convenience of a boutique hotel with the comforts of home. 

We're a mile away from the lakefront's bike trails, running paths, beaches and gardens, not to mention breathtaking scenery of waterfront skylines. Of course, we're conveniently situated for business travelers attending conventions at McCormick Place or meetings with major corporations downtown, as well as institutions of higher learning, such as IIT, UIC, Northwestern and the University of Chicago, both the downtown and Hyde Park campuses.

Getting around is easy as we're only a block away from the public transit stop. There, you can catch the train that'll take you directly downtown in minutes or you can transfer to other trains for connecting to all parts of the city, including both airports. 

If you have a car there is ample, free street parking and the Loop is only a 10 minute drive. In addition to the train, we highly recommend rideshare services from either Uber or Lyft, which are very economically priced from our place for getting around the city.

This is a great place for you if you'd like to be close to the energy of Chicago's vibrant Loop but want to experience a unique, local neighborhood.

Guests have complete access to our modern, fully-equipped kitchen so long as it's kept clean after each use.

Guests are provided city guides and public transit info via Acehopper, "Airbnb's front desk concierge", available for iPhone, iPad and Android devices, for tickets, guides and tips on local places to visit. 

When I’m around, I like to entertain. I’ll definitely make your stay a comfortable and memorable visit to the area.  Sometimes I’m busy, but I’ll do my best to accommodate your needs.

Experience the city like a true, native Chicagoan. Close to several parks and restaurants. Only a mile away from the beautiful Chicago Lakefront and Beaches! Plenty of trails for biking, walking and jogging. Enjoy water sports at the nearby harbor: 
* Jet skis
* Kayaks
* Flyboards
* Paddleboards 

Plus spectacular views of Chicago's magnificent skyline.

Nearest public transit is less than one block away, arriving every 5-10 minutes. Bike shares are available at the station. Just download Acehopper for iPhone and Android for public transit times, bike sharing availability and info for local events and attractions, including maps and tickets for purchase direct from your phone or tablet. Of course, we also recommend rideshare services such as Uber and Lyft to navigate around the city.

All shoes must be taken off at the door. Feel free to bring house slippers. No pets. Please be energy conscious and turn off lights and electronics when leaving. Please also clean up after use the common areas such as the kitchen (especially dishes and appliances), hallway bathroom, living and dining rooms.

description:
A cute and clean Daybed in a light filled and spacious living room in a 3 bedroom apartment! The bedroom has a brand new twin sized bed with 7 inch memory foam mattress. Both the bathroom and a kitchen have been recently remodeled and shared by the other guests . WiFi is abundant throughout the apartment. There is a full kitchen available.

My place is right across to Douglas Park and a block away from Lagunitas Brewery and 4 Blocks to the California Pink Line Station. It takes 20 mins to the Loop by the Pink Line. A walking distance to Pete's Fresh Market and WalMart also is a great convenience.

additional_house_rules:
- You agree to the following:
- 
- CHECK-IN: is on or after 5 PM unless otherwise agreed to in writing as our cleaning staff needs sufficient time to prepare. Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing 
- KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB
- BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you 
- QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. Any additional occupants in excess of the # on your reservation must be approved by me whether in your unit or in common areas. Any damage from you or your guests will result in immediate expulsion, at an additional cost to you, a claim with Airbnb and subsequent legal action 
- SMOKING: whether inside your unit, in a common area or roof deck, no smoking of any substance is allowed. Smoke damage to a unit will result in a $1000 fee
- PETS: you understand pets are not allowed in your unit. Pet damage may result in additional fees
- MISSING ITEMS: will be charged to you in a claim 
- ID CHECK: per the rules of this community, we'll request you submit your Government Issued Photo ID at the time of your e-check in via our site. You'll have to also agree to our terms of service. We're required to do a public records check for certain communities
- BREACH: any violation of the above shall result in immediate removal from the property at an additional cost to you
- BOOKING WITHIN 24 HRS: We'll send a request for a $500-1000 deposit which shall be fully returned on checkout

description:
Gorgeous 1BD/1BA Unit in the heart of Chicago - Rivernorth. Professionally managed and fully stocked w/ everything from salt, pepper, shampoo and body-wash to a sparkling water welcome gift!

We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week

Our apartments are located in an upscale metropolitan neighborhood that borders the Magnificent Mile, and is just across the bridge from the Loop. River North is the go-to district for those who appreciate food, fine art and design. This exceptional living space features private balconies, over-sized closets, and hardwood flooring. Enjoy the outdoor rooftop pool and terrace with BBQ grills while looking at the scenic view of the city. Other essentials are provided such as free fast wifi, kitchen/cookware and bathroom amenities. If there are any further questions or concerns, our incredible customer support team are here to assist.

We offer rewards and complimentary upgrades to our regular repeat guests

description:
Top floor condominium in a beautiful Victorian style row home in the heart of the Tri-Taylor area. The building went through a complete gut rehab in 2008, and this unit was updated again in 2013.
This home is set along the quiet, tree-lined streets of the Tri-Taylor area.  Claremont Park and restaurants on Taylor St are within walking distance.
The United Center, Union Park, Randolph St, Douglas Park, Little Italy, UIC, Rush Hospital, Stroger Hospital, Cook County Hospital are all within 2 miles

Top floor, two bedroom/one bathroom condominium in a beautiful Victorian style row home in the heart of the Tri-Taylor area.   Recently renovated with a modern open concept floorpan, large skylights, 11 foot ceilings, and central air conditioning!

The two large skylights in the kitchen provide tons of natural light.  Updated cabinets, granite countertops, and stainless steel appliances.  Keurig coffee machine and George Foreman are added amenities.  
***The microwave is currently broken.

The living room has a 65" LED w Bose sound system, as well as a desk for those who may be traveling professionally.

Bedroom 1 has a Queen Bed as well as a full size dresser.

Bedroom 2 has two twin beds and a nightstand.

Stackable, in unit laundry located in the kitchen closet or pantry.

Claremont Avenue is "PERMIT PARKING ONLY".  Free parking is located on Western Avenue or W Campbell Park Drive (please see photos).
One parking permit per day will be available to all AirBNB guests.  
***A parking spot located on the property is not included.
If you have any questions please ask.
Thank you!

I currently live .7 miles from this property and work from home.  I  am almost always available, and will provide you with my cell phone number.

This home is set along the quiet, tree-lined streets of the Tri-Taylor area.  Claremont Park and the restaurants on Taylor Street are within walking distance.
The United Center, Douglas Park, Little Italy, University of Illinois @ Chicago, Rush Hospital, Stroger Hospital, Cook County Hospital are all near-by.
Claremont Avenue is "PERMIT PARKING ONLY".  Free parking is located on Western Avenue or W Campell Park Drive (please see photos).

Uber/Lyft is definitely the most convenient, and is affordable as you are not too far north or south, and only about 3 miles from the Loop.
Included in the pictures is a map of the "L" or train system.

WHEN CHECKING OUT, THE KEYS MUST BE RETURNED TO THE LOCK BOX!!!  IF FOR SOME REASON THE LOCK BOX IS NOT WORKING, PLEASE CALL ME.
ALSO, PLEASE DO NOT ACCESS THE ROOF TOP!  THERE IS NOT A DECK, THERE ARE NO RAILINGS; AND THEREFORE NOT PERMITTED AS IT IS VERY DANGEROUS!!! 
THANK YOU!!!

access: You have complete access to the full space of the property.
description:
Welcome to our comfy 3 bedroom Wrigleyville apartment where you're steps away from Cubs Stadium, exciting nightlife, the train and plenty of restaurants! This apartment is perfect for families or groups looking to catch a Cubs baseball game or travelers looking to explore one of Chicago's most historic neighborhoods. You are just STEPS away from our favorite restaurants, bars and the infamous Clark St! Whether you watch a baseball game or enjoy a famous Chicago hotdog, you'll enjoy!

Parking is available and can be reserved through the app,  SpotHero. Please download it from your device app store.

You have complete access to the full space of the property.

Please reach out to us if you have any questions or concerns! We are here to make sure you have an excellent stay at our place.

There are stairs leading up to the unit.

access: Explained above. Mechanical room is not for guest access either.
description:
BEST Location !!! Classic home with updated kitchen, heated floors, central A/C, additional A/C for master bedroom, private exterior hot tub with 32 massage jets, 3 full bathrooms, 2 car garage (1 spot available for small vehicle). Private backyard w BBQ deck, laundry, dishwasher. Master bedroom has a king size bed, Guest bedroom queen size bed.  Bedroom 3 has no mattress. TV room has one large couch suitable for sleeping (1 guest). 2 x 50 gal water heaters, coffee maker, cooking / dining ware

Everything except for lower level office & master bedroom closets.

Explained above. Mechanical room is not for guest access either.

I will be available via cellphone anytime.

Hottest neighborhood in Chicago. Located 2.5 miles northwest of downtown full of restaurants, bars, shops. House is walking distance to all the action, a few steps from the intersection of Division & Damen

Drive if you can. Your rental Includes one parking spot in the garage. But if drinking or going to crowded places Uber or cabs are easily reachable. There are also rental bikes and scooters widely available.

House is delivered in working condition and clean. I take great care of the property and expect guests to do the same. House is for 5 guests (2 in master bedroom, 2 in guest bedroom and 1 in the large TV room couch. All 3 (three) full bathrooms are working and available.

Thermostat controls central air, master bedroom has its own AC unit controlled with the remote. Blackout shades in master bedroom also are controlled with remote. Access to the garage is limited. Mechanical room is not allowed.

access: You are welcome to make yourself at home! Please feel free to lounge on the plushy couches and watch Netflix, HBO and slingTV. You have access to the single shared bathroom in the apartment, and are welcome to use any appliances within (Flat iron, blow-dryer).  The kitchen is complete with any type of dish, pan or appliance you may need, and there is reserved shelving for you to use in the fridge. (Some appliances are stored in the cabinet, feel free to pull them out for use during your stay or send me a note and I am happy to set it up for you) A washer and dryer are available in the building and are coin operated (If you notify me prior that you plan to use the machines I will have coins and detergent available).  There is a backyard with a small table covered by an umbrella, a fire pit and small grill available for your use. The pool: Yes you may use the pool, its FREE, I will have a schedule for you in the welcome packet along with a beach towel for your convenience. (Open June 16th- Labor Day)
description:
A warm, furnished bedroom in a 3rd floor apartment that overlooks beautiful Holstein Park (w/pool) and has East facing views of the city.  Nearby access to "El" train, 606 Trail, grocery store, and ample parking make this the perfect place to stay. 
Note: I travel often for work and some guests may find they have the place entirely to themselves (Except for my bedroom). I will set a higher rate for dates that I am completely absent from the apartment.

It is fit for a dream: a brand new full size plush mattress, bed spread and fresh towels furnish the private bedroom. A small TV is in the bedroom with Amazon Fire stick that allows you to access Netflix/iTunes/apps. You have sunny views of Holstein Park, and can see the signature skyscrapers John Hancock and Trump Tower from your bedroom on clear days/nights. If you prefer to sleep in, the wood blinds provide a "blackout" affect during the day, keeping your room cool and dim for daytime naps. There is a mirror over a writing desk serving as a dual space for your laptop or as a vanity. The bedroom door locks and you will be provided a key for entry.

You are welcome to make yourself at home! Please feel free to lounge on the plushy couches and watch Netflix, HBO and slingTV. You have access to the single shared bathroom in the apartment, and are welcome to use any appliances within (Flat iron, blow-dryer).  The kitchen is complete with any type of dish, pan or appliance you may need, and there is reserved shelving for you to use in the fridge. (Some appliances are stored in the cabinet, feel free to pull them out for use during your stay or send me a note and I am happy to set it up for you) A washer and dryer are available in the building and are coin operated (If you notify me prior that you plan to use the machines I will have coins and detergent available).  There is a backyard with a small table covered by an umbrella, a fire pit and small grill available for your use. The pool: Yes you may use the pool, its FREE, I will have a schedule for you in the welcome packet along with a beach towel for your convenience. (Open June 16th- Labor Day)

I will be staying in the bedroom at the back end of the apartment off the kitchen (unless I am traveling myself) and will be available anytime that I am home, if not please reach me by phone.  On the weekdays I typically get up for work and get ready between 6:30am - 8:00am.  I will be out of the space for the majority of the day and try to stay out and active in the city during the summer weekends. There can be as much or as little interaction as you prefer, I really will leave it to the guests to interact at their own comfort.

Bucktown is an old Chicago neighborhood, the people that live here have pride in their homes, parks, and art fairs! It is a safe and quiet nook between the more bustling area of Wicker Park and hipster neighborhood Logan Square. You will find young couples, dog lovers and new families walking around the park. Some of the best restaurants in Chicago are located in Bucktown and are listed in the Guidebook.

Walking distance (4 blocks) to the Blue Line "El" access to both OHare International Airport and Downtown. Just a few blocks from the 90/94 highway exit and entrance ramps. Parking is plentiful, free and does not require a permit. A covered parking space in the garage can be made available upon request for an additional $5/night charge.  Uber is abundant and popular in the area.

Requests for a late check out will cost an additional $30 and must be arranged at least one week prior to your check in date. (This includes storing your luggage in the space until your departure). I will do my best to accommodate early check in if it is needed but I cannot promise it will be granted. I recommend you plan to arrive after the 4pm check in time. 

If you have an itinerary or specific schedule to adhere to, I'd like for you to share it with me so that I can make sure you are best accommodated to having the shower, and kitchen, etc. when you need it most. (Without me in the way!)

4. Lock the doors upon entry and exit of both the building and the apartment.

6. No smoking.
7. No guests.

Note: I travel often for work and some guests may find they have the place entirely to themselves (Except for my bedroom). I will set a higher rate for dates that I am completely absent from the apartment.
transit: Walking distance (4 blocks) to the Blue Line "El" access to both OHare International Airport and Downtown. Just a few blocks from the 90/94 highway exit and entrance ramps. Parking is plentiful, free and does not require a permit. A covered parking space in the garage can be made available upon request for an additional $5/night charge.  Uber is abundant and popular in the area.

access: Access is available to the entire apartment.
description:
Embrace inner peace in this serene suite. Featuring views of Lake Michigan, a pool, art deco touches, and a Victrola record player, this apartment gives you all the necessities you need to unwind after a long day of work or play. Take a deep breath, make some tea, and pick up your favorite coffee table book for a relaxing evening at (almost) home.

Access is available to the entire apartment.

We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other concierge services that interest you.

Hyde Park, home to the prestigious University of Chicago and the Museum of Science and Industry, is a culturally rich neighborhood full of eclectic shops, restaurants, and small businesses. Enjoy a stroll in one of the area’s many parks—or explore Chicago by bike when you hop on the Lakefront Trail and cruise for miles.

Cab/Uber service is readily available in this location and is our preferred method of transportation downtown. The unit is three blocks to the nearest Metra station that takes you directly to the Loop and is also near several major bus routes.

We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered. If anything is not to your liking, please notify us, and we will correct the situation as soon as possible.

access: You will have use of your private room and guest bathroom. Kitchen available for heating food in the microwave and limited food storage in the refrigerator.
description:
Private room close to great dining, shopping, and METRA rail (easy access to downtown Chicago). 12 minute drive to the Ravinia Festival or free shuttle from downtown Highland Park.

Large private room close to  highways, public transportation, and shopping. Large desk, perfect for your laptop computer, along with dressers and a large closet. You have your own bathroom a few feet away.

You will have use of your private room and guest bathroom. Kitchen available for heating food in the microwave and limited food storage in the refrigerator.

Hosts will be home during your stay, and normally will interact with you on a regular basis. Filmore, our 9 year old male miniature poodle, may also interact with you, and has free run of our home. He is very friendly and enjoys belly rubs. He will usually greet you when you come in the door.

Beautiful homes on gorgeous tree lined block. Close to restaurants, shopping, and the Ravinia Festival. Second bedroom available by request for an additional fee.

Pace bus system. 5 minutes to METRA rail by car. You could also walk to the train in about 10 minutes. 5 minutes to Route 41 for points north and south. 1.7 miles to Highland Park Hospital.

Guests must provide their own food, drinks,  toiletries, cleaning and cooking supplies, and detergent. Our computers and printers are available on a case-by-case basis. Applicable to full house rentals only.
house_rules: Rooms should be kept clean and neat. No food or garbage. No smoking - no pets. No overnight guests that are not part of the booking. No children under the age of 12 can be guests. Garage, when available,  is strictly for parking your automobile, and is not available for any type of storage. All belongings must be contained in your room, and limited to clothing and personal items brought in your vehicle. Host or their designee reserve the right to visit and inspect the private room with proper notice for all stays over 7 days.

additional_house_rules:
We have surveillance and/or recording devices at the property ONLY in our common areas including: 
2 in the kitchen, 1 in the upstairs hall, 1 in the downstairs hall, 1 in the living room, 1 in the family room,  1  pointing at the front door, 1 in the dining room, 1 ring doorbell,  1 outside pointing at the patio. 

Renting with us means that you have read and accepted that fact that common areas are being surveyed and/or recorded for the safety and security of our home, ourselves and our guests. 


All guests must clean what they use. That includes dishes. 

NOTE: The private bedrooms lock with a key. In the case of a guest forgetting to leave his key or if a key is lost, there will be an additional fee of $20.00 to replace said key. This covers the cost of replacing the lock and is non negotiable.

description:
I am renting a bedroom in a great SAFE area here in Chicago, with 2 bus stops 2 blocks away, super quiet place, great accommodation. This bedroom is the only private room with its own private bath. King size bed. Computer desk. 

Alugo quarto em ótimo setor aqui em Chicago, com ponto de ônibus a duas quadras, lugar super tranquilo, ótima acomodação.

Com cama, aquecedor central, closet, acesso a todas as áreas comuns: 2 salas de jantar, 2 salas de estar, terraços, amplo jardim, cozinha (podendo utilizar todos utensílios da cozinha), sala/bar para assistir jogos. 

Including a king size bed, closet, central heating, access to all common areas: 2 dining rooms, 2 living rooms, padio, enormous backyard, kitchen (can use all kitchen utensils), lounge / bar to watch sporting events.

Brazilians like to host. You will feel at home.
house_rules:
We have surveillance and/or recording devices at the property ONLY in our common areas including: 
2 in the kitchen, 1 in the upstairs hall, 1 in the downstairs hall, 1 in the living room, 1 in the family room,  1  pointing at the front door, 1 in the dining room, 1 ring doorbell,  1 outside pointing at the patio. 

Renting with us means that you have read and accepted that fact that common areas are being surveyed and/or recorded for the safety and security of our home, ourselves and our guests. 


All guests must clean what they use. That includes dishes. 

NOTE: The private bedrooms lock with a key. In the case of a guest forgetting to leave his key or if a key is lost, there will be an additional fee of $20.00 to replace said key. This covers the cost of replacing the lock and is non negotiable.
interaction: Brazilians like to host. You will feel at home.

Across from McCormick perfect Chicago location! 2 Queen beds, luxury condo w/ balcony - Green Line Train stop and Michigan ave bus is right outside the building, Very close to Soldier Field , HUGE POOL AND HOT TUB FOR RELAXATION & Gym & Business Center . Store right outside. Monthly parking available.

2BR  1100ft2 condo
w/d in unit attached garage - extra fees for parking 
Welcome to the  Chicago -- far from your typical Chicago rental. offers unparalleled amenities, upscale stylish accommodations, and floor-to-ceiling dynamic views of the Chicago skyline. This property is unlike any other in its class and the experience is definitely one-of-a-kind.

PRIVATE CONDO AMENITIES
•Granite kitchen and breakfast bar -- fully stocked with plates, glassware, silverware, etc
•Granite bathroom and shower -- towels and linens included
•Dark hardwood floors throughout and modern rugs throughout condo
•Modern leather sectional sofa 
•Queen bedroom with 500-thread count linens and pillow top mattress
•Sheik modern design and furniture inspired from European design
•55" LED LCD TV and Surround Sound
•WiFi, cable TV, movies, and all utilities included
•Parking available on street or indoor heated garage (for extra fee)

AMENITIES 
•the BOILER ROOM -- 24-hour fitness center
•the LIBRARY -- 24-hour business center
•the LIVING ROOM -- Party lounge with billiards, fireplace, and TV
•the PLAYGROUND -- Expansive landscaped deck including outdoor pool and hot tub featuring barbeque grills, lounge seating, fire pit and panoramic views of the lake, Downtown Chicago and the entire South Loop Pinball machine in lobby
•Complimentary Wi-Fi in the apartment common areas
•On-site professional apartment management
•Private dog run 
•24-hour door staff and maintenance
•On-site heated parking garage
•Furnished overnight guest suite
•Bicycle and resident storage
•Close to Chicago's public transportation, highways and lakefront recreation
•A smoke-free Chicago apartment property designed for LEED certification


Please let us know your dates. We'll give you a direct quote. Will respond to all inquiries.

additional_house_rules:
Welcome to my home. I will do my best to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. 

Mindful of the needs of my neighbors, please no parties, or engaging in any illegal activities anywhere on the premises. 
Please remove your shoes when you enter, the floors were recently refurbished. 
Please no smoking inside the premises. 
Registered guests only. 
If you break or damage an item, please arrange for its replacement or repair. 
Feel free to bring in food. Please clean up after yourself, especially food scraps.  My home is pest-free, and help me to keep it that way. 
 
Washer and Dryer available to guests staying one week or more.

access: In addition to the bedroom and bathroom, guest will have access to kitchen with several amenities: coffee maker, toaster, toaster-oven, crock pot, and Nija food processor, and space in the refrigerator. The dining room space with a large cherry wood table seats 6 people, and living room with cable TV.
description:
Experience my century-old home where vintage charm meets the modern open space. Distinctive characteristics include a unique natural light design,  an earth-tone color palette,  a newly renovated bathroom with a walk-in shower, and WiFi.  Though the internal structure sports a unique floor plan with ample space for individual privacy, the main bath is shared. 

Close to downtown Evanston, Northwestern University, and to public transportation. Walking distance to Presence St. Francis Hospital.

Experience my century-old home which offers distinctive characteristics such as an open concept plan, earth-tone color palette, unique natural light design, a newly remodeled bathroom; and free parking on site.  

The unique floor plan provides ample space for privacy; however, the main bathroom is shared.

In addition to the bedroom and bathroom, guest will have access to kitchen with several amenities: coffee maker, toaster, toaster-oven, crock pot, and Nija food processor, and space in the refrigerator. The dining room space with a large cherry wood table seats 6 people, and living room with cable TV.

I enjoy meeting new people, and hosting Airbnb guests and travelers from all over the world. I am also respectful of your privacy, and your need for quiet time. When you need directions of where to go and what to see, I will do my best to accommodate your requests. I am committed to making your stay an enjoyable one and relaxing one. 

I am a teacher by profession, and arrive home by 4:30 pm.  Though I enjoy being home to welcome guests, your schedule may necessitate an earlier arrival. If you plan to come earlier, please let me know and I will send  your passcode with instructions of how to use the keyless entry pad.

Located in the Oakton Historic District, the neighborhood boasts of older homes, multi-dwelling housing, two parks, and an elementary school. The neighbors are friendly, and take great pride with maintaining their homes and yards. Enjoy a walk around the neighborhood, you will meet friendly neighbors, and you'll discover some hidden beauty in architecture, some sustainable initiatives such as perennial gardens with lots of pollinator plants, composting, and a bee-keeper.

There are two parks in close proximity to my front door.  Walk north about a block and you will discover  a basketball court, baseball diamond, and an open field for soccer.  For families with young children, just one block east is an open space with a playscape.

My home is close to public transportation, about a mile from the Purple Line (EL) train, and the Metra.  My residence is a five minute drive south of Northwestern University. It is a 10 minute walk east to St. Francis Presence Hospital and within close proximity to local restaurants. 

If you are driving, you'll have your own place to park your vehicle on the lot in the back of the house.  There are lots of places to shop, and great restaurants within the area.

Throughout my life I've had experience sharing space with others in many different settings. I do understand and respect a person's need for space and privacy. You may have noticed that my unique floor-plan design provides ample space for privacy. However, there is one main space shared in common, that's the bathroom. The bathroom has two entry doors to access the shower, through the master bedroom, and the powder room. Guest using the master bedroom have easy access directly from the bedroom. Other guests, enter through the powder room.

Other guests, enter through the powder room.
space:
Experience my century-old home which offers distinctive characteristics such as an open concept plan, earth-tone color palette, unique natural light design, a newly remodeled bathroom; and free parking on site.  

The unique floor plan provides ample space for privacy; however, the main bathroom is shared.
summary:
Experience my century-old home where vintage charm meets the modern open space. Distinctive characteristics include a unique natural light design,  an earth-tone color palette,  a newly renovated bathroom with a walk-in shower, and WiFi.  Though the internal structure sports a unique floor plan with ample space for individual privacy, the main bath is shared. 

Close to downtown Evanston, Northwestern University, and to public transportation. Walking distance to Presence St. Francis Hospital.
transit:
My home is close to public transportation, about a mile from the Purple Line (EL) train, and the Metra.  My residence is a five minute drive south of Northwestern University. It is a 10 minute walk east to St. Francis Presence Hospital and within close proximity to local restaurants. 

If you are driving, you'll have your own place to park your vehicle on the lot in the back of the house.  There are lots of places to shop, and great restaurants within the area.

access: A key code will be given prior to arrival.  Please review your airbnb confirmation page for instructions, directions and more.
description:
This AD is for a Bunk bed, in a shared room(s) with other guests, based on availability.  Bunk bed may be a full size or twin size bed based on availability. There are no sharing beds. This is NOT a private room. The rate is $350 per month, per person.  I will adjust the rate based on the offer when booking for 2 or more.

You will be staying in EITHER of the TWO (2) SHARED ROOMS! One room sleeps 6, the other room sleeps 4.  The location of the space will be based on availability at the time of your arrival. (The monthly rate is $350 per month, per person.)

You will have access to a full kitchen equipped with utensils, pots and more.  The kitchen in the apartment is closed from 10 pm. until 9 a.m.  However, there is another kitchen (and bathroom) on the lower level that is available 24 hours.  The kitchen in the lower level is equipped with a  microwave and refrigerator.

FREE PERKS INCLUDE:

- FREE pickup from 87th & Jeffrey 
(From 10p.m.- midnight).; NO SHUTTLE if weather is below 35 degrees)

- FREE TRIP TO HORSESHOE CASINO (Fri-Sun)
- FREE Parking
- FREE Wifi Internet
- FREE Coffee, Tea and more
- FREE Linen & Towels
- FREE Use of Kitchen appliances, pots, utensil
- FREE Museum tips - Shedd, Art, Field, or Science & 
Industry & More! (based on availability)

A key code will be given prior to arrival.  Please review your airbnb confirmation page for instructions, directions and more.

Arrivals Monday - Friday - Checkin is officially after 6 p.m.  However, you may arrive as earlier and wait in the lower level.  The lower level is NOT where you will be staying and therefore there are no photos listed to reflect this area.  This is a WAITING AREA ONLY.  I will have someone to meet up with you.  Please let me know at least the day before approximately what time you will be arriving.

You may arrive earlier on the weekend since I will be available during the day.  Beds will not be available until after 6 p.m.

I am located in the apartment on the first floor apartment.  All guests are located on the 2nd floor.

The neighborhood is a quiet residential area.  I am 10 minutes by car from the beach; less than 5 miles from University of Chicago and 10 minutes from the Horseshoe Casino.

NEARBY TRANSIT LOCATION:

You have a couple of options to reach my home to downtown: 

Option 1 -   The '87th Street' bus stop is located at the corner of my block.  This bus will connect you to the Jeffrey bus.  The Jeffrey bus will arrive to downtown within 35 minutes.  From downtown you can catch the Jeffrey bus on Michigan Avenue. 

Option 2 - Take the 87th bus to the Red line train.

Option 3 - The metra train is a 10 min walk away.  It will bring you to the loop in 20 minutes.

DISTANCE TO CITY CENTER/DOWNTOWN LOOP.

My home is located approximately 11 miles from downtown/Loop area. It is a 45 minute ride to downtown loop by bus; or a 20 minutes drive by car.   I am less than 5 miles away from President Obama's Home and the University of Chicago.

description:
Newly renovated and furnished apartment unit one block away from the oak park art district.  Comes with a full kitchen to fulfill any and all of your cooking needs.  As well as one bedroom with a queen size bed capable of sleeping 2.  0.6 miles to Chicago public transportation's Blue Line train taking you to the heart of downtown chicago in only 30 minutes.  Also if you have a vehicle the apartment is only 0.6 miles from the 290 highway that can be taken to any neighborhood in chicago.

Entire apartment is available to the guest. Including a fully stocked kitchen the queen size bed, cable TV, internet, and a washer and dryer

additional_house_rules:
HOUSE RULES
1. All bookings require a security deposit of $100 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance.
2. As per the Airbnb rules - Free cancellation for 48 hours after booking. 48 hours later full refund minus the cleaning fee. 5 days before check-in 50% refund minus the first night and the cleaning fee.
3. No smoking of any kind - no vapes, cigarettes, cigars, or weed. That means NO cannabis or tobacco derived substances in the apartment, porches, decks, backyard, front yard, anywhere on the premises.
4. No pets of any kind.
5. ALL GUESTS MUST BE KIND AND RESPECTFUL TO THE OTHER TENANTS IN THE BUILDING AND THE NEIGHBORS.
6. DO NOT MAKE ANY ATTEMPT  to contact the tenants occupying the other floors, EVEN IF you have locked yourself out or cannot get into the building.
7. ALL GUESTS MUST TREAT THE ENTIRE PREMISES WITH THE UPMOST RESPECT AND CARE.
8. The backyard is OFF LIMITS. Do not use the back stairwell, except in the case of a fire or a similar type of emergency.
9. NO OTHER GUESTS ALLOWED. Only those listed on your reservation are allowed on the premises. If you would like to receive a visitor, you must get approval from the host before they enter the premises. 
10. No excessive noise of any kind at any time.
11. Guest take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events.
12. If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full.
13. If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or any individuals, let me know immediately. 
14. If any of these house rules are violated, Airbnb will be notified immediately, you will be removed from the premises and will be expected to pay for the balance of your scheduled stay.
15. If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guest will be charged $50 per hour of the delay. This fee applies to any late checkout between 11:00am and 1:00pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1:00pm will be charged for an extra night, and will be contacted by Airbnb to vacate the premises immediately if another guest is expected to arrive at 3:00pm. This does not apply if the guest has worked something out with the host and Airbnb in advance.

You must also acknowledge:
•	No parking on the property - parking available up and down the streets
•	Must climb stairs - 2nd or 3rd floor walk up
•	Some spaces are shared - The front yard, entrance, lobby, stairs, basement, and back deck stairwell are all shared with the building tenants on the other floors.
•	Surveillance or recording devices on property.
•	2-day minimum stay on the weekends, unless approved by the host. 1-night min-stay Monday - Thursday.
The long term tenants on the first floor have a dog.

description:
NEW - Enjoy a very short walk down a beautiful tree-lined street to the best beach in Chicago on Lake Michigan, near Wrigley Field too. This full 2nd floor home in a 3-flat bldg in a heritage neighborhood was creatively redone in a Mid-Century Modern style by Haute Bohemian. A new kitchen, bathrooms, lighting and more, your thoughtfully detailed Chicago pad will have what you need to enjoy the city trails, beach, and downtown, including bikes. The combination of style and location can't be beat.

NEW on Airbnb as of 3-18-2019, this is a 3 bedroom heritage place located on a beautiful tree-lined street, has been redone in a comfortable mid-century modern style. As a fashion exec, I care about style and comfort.  I took great pride and care in choosing high quality materials within a thoughtful presentation.  We think you'll appreciate the original door knobs and trim and the new furniture, cabinetry, appliances, and light fixtures for the craftsmanship and character. There is free parking on the street in front of the property and all around the neighborhood available on a first come first serve basis. The lakefront trail entrance is 1/2  block, express bus to Michigan Ave. and The Loop stops on the corner 1/2 a block down. 15 min walk to the L train red line, and Wrigley Field is 1 mile away. Uber/Lyft usually come in less than 5 minutes. A gem of a Chicago neighborhood, we are surrounded by Andersonville, Boystown, Lakeview, Wrigleyville and the theaters of Uptown, Aragon. Ballroom, Riviera, and the famous Greenmill jazz lounge.

The entire 1800 square foot condo and all common areas including the backyard.

Text us the day before to give us your ETA. We're nearby.

Buena Park is Chicago's best kept secret. The beach, the marina, the hip Dollop coffeehouse and awesome North Buena Wine and Deli are closeby. In the summer we hang out at the beach and the Dock restaurant. The famous Greenmill jazz club is pretty close too. Lots of great restaurants and Wrigley are short walks away.

You can walk to the beach and bike paths, and all over the beautiful historic neighborhood. Uber/Lyft's usually come in 3 min. The bus at the end of the block goes right downtown to Michigan Ave. Uber/Lyft usually 3 min. away. Other great neighborhoods like Lakeville, Andersonville and Wrigleyville are next door.

You must take your keys with you when you leave. Both of the main building entrance doors lock automatically behind you.
house_rules:
HOUSE RULES
1. All bookings require a security deposit of $100 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance.
2. As per the Airbnb rules - Free cancellation for 48 hours after booking. 48 hours later full refund minus the cleaning fee. 5 days before check-in 50% refund minus the first night and the cleaning fee.
3. No smoking of any kind - no vapes, cigarettes, cigars, or weed. That means NO cannabis or tobacco derived substances in the apartment, porches, decks, backyard, front yard, anywhere on the premises.
4. No pets of any kind.
5. ALL GUESTS MUST BE KIND AND RESPECTFUL TO THE OTHER TENANTS IN THE BUILDING AND THE NEIGHBORS.
6. DO NOT MAKE ANY ATTEMPT  to contact the tenants occupying the other floors, EVEN IF you have locked yourself out or cannot get into the building.
7. ALL GUESTS MUST TREAT THE ENTIRE PREMISES WITH THE UPMOST RESPECT AND CARE.
8. The backyard is OFF LIMITS. Do not use the back stairwell, except in the case of a fire or a similar type of emergency.
9. NO OTHER GUESTS ALLOWED. Only those listed on your reservation are allowed on the premises. If you would like to receive a visitor, you must get approval from the host before they enter the premises. 
10. No excessive noise of any kind at any time.
11. Guest take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events.
12. If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full.
13. If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or any individuals, let me know immediately. 
14. If any of these house rules are violated, Airbnb will be notified immediately, you will be removed from the premises and will be expected to pay for the balance of your scheduled stay.
15. If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guest will be charged $50 per hour of the delay. This fee applies to any late checkout between 11:00am and 1:00pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1:00pm will be charged for an extra night, and will be contacted by Airbnb to vacate the premises immediately if another guest is expected to arrive at 3:00pm. This does not apply if the guest has worked something out with the host and Airbnb in advance.

You must also acknowledge:
•	No parking on the property - parking available up and down the streets
•	Must climb stairs - 2nd or 3rd floor walk up
•	Some spaces are shared - The front yard, entrance, lobby, stairs, basement, and back deck stairwell are all shared with the building tenants on the other floors.
•	Surveillance or recording devices on property.
•	2-day minimum stay on the weekends, unless approved by the host. 1-night min-stay Monday - Thursday.
The long term tenants on the first floor have a dog.

description: The downtown South Loop is a vibrant area featuring eclectic eateries, shops, museums, theaters and parks. Comprised mostly of high-rises, it’s also home to the 108-story Willis Tower. The iconic “Cloud Gate” sculpture sits in Millennium Park. Grant Park features the large, rococo-style Buckingham Fountain and the renowned Art Institute of Chicago, and hosts annual events like The Taste of Chicago and Lollapalooza. Breathtaking view of Lake Michigan can be seen from the apartment also!

access: Access is available to the entire apartment.
description:
If all you’ve ever wanted in your accommodations is a homey loft in a bustling neighborhood, with high ceilings, charming archways, original wood detailing, a full bath, a half bath, a combination den/office, a book about David Bowie sitting next to a record by David Bowie on top of a mantelpiece, and a short walk to a Great Lake, then boy do we have the spot for you!

When you choose Zencity, you can say farewell to renting “rooms” in someone else’s dusty basement or running into your host on the way back from a shower. Instead, say hello to a clean room, the freshest of towels, 24-hour entry, and a customer service agent always happy to answer any and all questions. Oh, and did we mention there’s an Eames chair? So sit back and stay awhile.

Access is available to the entire apartment.

We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other concierge services that interest you.

Lincoln Park The Neighborhood is a haven for young families and professionals, with hip restaurants and entertainment venues and plenty of fun shops along walkable streets. Lincoln Park The Park is home to 1,200+ acres of green space and a world-class zoo. Lions? Tigers? Bears?! Oh, yeah.

Cab/Uber service is easily available in this location and is our recommended method of transportation to nearby hotspots such as Old Town to the south and Wicker Park/Bucktown to the west. The apartment is also near several major bus routes.

We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered. If anything is not to your liking, please notify us, and we will correct the situation as soon as possible.
