description:
Large Home close to Wrigley Field, Restaurants and all that Chicago has to offer. You will enjoy all the restaurants, shopping and public transportation right at your fingertips. Free overnight parking permits (just ask :)). This beautiful home has onsite laundry, unlimited use of private back yard with operating pond & waterfall, and large kitchen perfect for families.

This home is one of the most unique on the block. The backyard has a private pond with a tomato tree! This is something that is near impossible to find at a home in Chicago. The backyard is so relaxing on a summer night. Other than the backyard, the home is spacious and great for families, groups and for those who are looking to hang out and pregame before a cubs game.

I will greet you at the house during check in or send you a code via message to let you in the house. Don't hesitate to ask me for recommendations for dinner or if you have any questions. I am always available to talk.

Tree-lined Lincoln Park offers diverse nightlife, dining and entertainment. North Lincoln Avenue features cocktail lounges, dive bars and concert venues such as Lincoln Hall. The revered Steppenwolf Theatre Company is on Halstead Street. Comedy clubs Up and Second City sit on the border with Old Town. Within the shoreline park are North Avenue Beach, the Chicago History Museum and the free-admission Lincoln Park Zoo.

I always recommend taking the train to commute around the city. The brown line “L” is a couple blocks away which is 2 stops from Wrigley Field!

description:
Are you looking for a five-star hotel? Unfortunately this isn't it. If you are looking for a simple/spacious place to sleep as you explore Chicago with easy access to the bus/train, you've found the place! 20 min Uber/Lyft/cab from O'Hare. Quick 81 Lawrence bus to the Blue Line train to access downtown or O'Hare airport. 8 min walk to the Brown Line train. 35 mins from the Loop during rush hour to see the world famous Chicago Bean, Sears Tower and all types of restaurants. Book today!

Is this room all booked for your dates? Book one of our other rooms in the same apartment by clicking on my photo (above "Warren" by the title of this listing) and looking at our availability in one of the other bedrooms!

This listing is for bedroom 2 (queen bed) in a 5 bedroom apartment. Easy access to transportation, easy check in.

Chicago is a terrific place for all types of restaurants, great food, easy transportation.

10 min Uber/Lyft/bus/train rides in any direction will take you to Indian, Japanese, Ethiopian, Mexican and any other type of food you can think of.

Don't want to go to far? We have all of those great restaurants in our Albany Park neighborhood as our neighborhood is SUPER diverse and I absolutely love it.

You can easily get to our place by 81 Lawrence bus which takes you directly to the Jefferson Park Blue Line (easy access to O'Hare airport). You can also take a quick Brown Line train downtown from Kimball and see all types of touristy destinations our great city has to offer.

p.s. We're foodies and LOVE to give both places to go and restaurant recommendations.

All in all, this is by no means a five-star resort. What you will get is a family owned place, long-term tenants in the floor downstairs (we're upstairs!) and a family-environment with easy access so you can check-in quickly and go explore all that our great city has to offer. At the end of the night, come back to your room for a clean bed to sleep on!

Message us on the app for questions! We're working folks so obviously if we don't respond we're probably in a meeting, but once we get the chance to reply we will!

Blue Line
Brown Line
81 Lawrence Bus
82 Kimball Bus

Hello! 

We'd absolutely love to have you stay with us! We've been blessed in our short time to have travelers from all over the world stay with us from France, to Malaysia to the U.S. We've had casual travelers to people here on work trips.

The happiest stays guests have had here are the people that understand what we're offering. You're basically in a hostel / shared space. A very low priced room with a lock, on average from $18-$22 USD per night depending on demand, that gives you a simple place to sleep and amenities to use. It is our guests that understand that this is NOT the Hilton or Marriott that have enjoyed this extremely low priced stay. This is my parents home, and we come through and clean often but ultimately there's daily wear and tear as on any given day our five rooms can be occupied with around 1-2 people each that you might see in passing. Our bathrooms will often look used, our floors will often be scuffed, our kitchen will look like someone actually uses it because, well, our guests do, and you just might be having a pleasant meal and/or drink out with one of your short term roommates! The most unhappy guests are ones that come in with unrealistic expectations. 

We mop / clean every day, but (ESPECIALLY) the bathroom will always look used because we're constantly having guests come in and out of the unit and to be honest, you all have different levels of personal cleanliness and these are shared common areas amongst other guests. Other guests have had unrealistic expectations from one not liking the sheets because they weren't fluffy, to others being surprised to see us in the common areas because we're cleaning, to others just thinking this is going to be just like a nice hotel (completely disregarding the fact that it's a shared space) when it's not.

The point is, we'd absolutely love to have you. Prior to your booking, if you totally understand this and want an affordable, home-y place to stay that you recognize is not a spotless hotel, please proceed with booking. We absolutely love meeting our guests from all over the country (and world!) If you anticipate even just this message being a problem I ask you please cancel your booking and book a hotel downtown. You're coming into two 70+ year olds homes (that's Mom and Dad, we all live upstairs) and if you want the vibes and every day shared living of a place that's near transportation, halfway between O'Hare airport and downtown, then we would be more than willing to welcome you into our home.

Thank you and we hope to see you soon :)

access: You have access to entire apartment!
description:
Stay in the heart of the Gold Coast. You will be just steps from Rush street and one of the most vibrant neighborhoods in Chicago, and just a 10 min walk to Lake Michigan and to Magnificent Mile. Here you'll find all the comforts of home: a full kitchen, custom artwork, and furnishings curated to reflect the beauty of the Windy City.

- 2 Queen beds
- 1 Air mattress
- 1 and 1/2 bath
- Toiletries
- Fully stocked kitchen
- Laptop friendly workspace
- Wifi
- Washer/dryer
- Iron and Hair dryer

You have access to entire apartment!

We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available and at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

Tons of restaurants, shops, cafes and boutiques in the immediate area. The 'Gold Coast' is one of the best areas of Chicago and centrally located to the many tourist attractions!

No parking in building. 

We recommend Uber or Lyft for getting around.

If parking, book a nearby spot online using Parkwhiz or Spothero.

Like what you see but it's not quite right? Please note that we have multiple listings available ranging from one to four bedroom apartments! Feel free to check out our other listings on our Airbnb profile.

additional_house_rules:
• Check-in is available after 4 pm. You will pick up your keys from the onsite guest service team upon arrival.

If you’re planning to arrive after 10pm, please call the reception at 1-847-657-0002 so that you’re not marked as a no-show in their system.

No shows on the day of arrival: If you do not check-in on your specified arrival date, and we have not received written notice of your late arrival or cancellation, then you will be marked as a no-show and your reservation will be cancelled (please note that the standard cancellation policy will apply).
• Check-out time is before 11 am. Please return your keys to the onsite guest services team.
• There is a light cleaning service provided every few days.
• Guests must be a minimum age of 21 years in order to make a reservation, and must occupy the unit for the duration of the stay. You will be asked to provide photo identification upon check-in. Any reservation made under false pretenses will forfeit all payments, and guests will be escorted from the property.

description:
Both business and leisure travelers love to stay in our suite, which is nestled in "The Glen" business district. It has many amenities you're sure to love, including:

• 1 Bedroom with 1 Queen bed
• On-site self-serve laundry facilities and in-house dry-cleaning service
• Air-conditioned living space
• Cable television and DVD player
• FREE standard Wi-Fi
• Fully-equipped kitchen
• Complimentary breakfast buffet with delicious options
• 24 hour business center and 24 hour fitness center
• Heated indoor pool
• On-site guest service team

Your next trip to Chicago starts with a stay in our suite! Business travelers will love being close to a variety of major businesses, including Allstate Insurance, Anixter, Kraft, and Mead Johnson. Northwestern University is also close by. There is a Metra Station within walking distance which provides guests easy access to downtown Chicago.

There is 1 BEDROOM with 1 Queen bed.

Get ready in our 1 BATHROOM with an accessible tub. We provide you with a hairdryer, towels, and complimentary toiletries. There are self-serve washing and drying machines available on-site. Same-day dry cleaning services are available.

Retreat to our air-conditioned LIVING SPACE. Curl up and enjoy your favorite shows on our flatscreen TV or watch your favorite movie with our DVD player. In-room movies are available on premium cable. You can easily connect with friends and family back home, courtesy of the complimentary Wi-Fi. Get some work done while you're away by taking advantage of the laptop-friendly space.

In the KITCHEN you'll find a stove, a microwave, a dishwasher, a refrigerator, cooking utensils, and dishes. You can enjoy all of your meals in the dining area. Start your morning with a cup of coffee, fresh from our in-suite coffee machine. In the morning, enjoy a complimentary breakfast buffet that features a variety of delicious options.

There are a number of other amenities you're sure to enjoy when you stay at Staybridge Chicago Glenview where our space is conveniently located. These include the business center, which is open 24-hours and has office supplies, printers, scanners, and business services. The fitness center is also open 24-hours and has 2 motorized treadmills, an elliptical machine, a stationary bike, and a 5 station multi-gym unit along with a small selection of free weights.

After working out, be sure to take advantage of the heated indoor pool, which is open from 8am to 10pm. Between Monday and Wednesday there is an evening reception for guests with food, drink, and more. Guest services are available on-site to ensure a stress-free stay.

If you're traveling by car, there is free parking available on-site.

A number of these units are available, and each is individually decorated. The images shown are a representation of the unit you will receive. At check-in, you will receive a unit of the same type as shown in this listing, complete with the advertised size and number of rooms, but the actual decor in the unit, view, and furniture layout may differ. You will have access to all amenities advertised!

A damage deposit will be processed as a pre-authorization on your credit card and will be released after your departure provided there is no damage, items missing, or extra cleaning required.

LOCAL FAVORITES

As our guest, you’ll enjoy easy access to excellent nightlife. Travel to downtown Chicago and experience the bustling bar scene or dine at one of the many gourmet restaurants. Glenview is home to the Kohl Children’s Museum, which has 17 different exhibits dedicated to instilling a love for learning in young children. The Illinois Holocaust Museum is only five miles away and features a myriad of powerful exhibits.

• FREE standard Wi-Fi
• Complimentary breakfast buffet to start your day
• The heated indoor pool is open from 8am to 10pm
• If you're traveling by car, there is free parking available on-site
• A number of these units are available, and each is individually decorated. The images shown are a representation of the unit you will receive. At check-in, you will receive a unit of the same type as shown in this listing, complete with the advertised size and number of rooms, but the actual decor in the unit, view, and furniture layout may differ. You will have access to all amenities advertised!
• A damage deposit will be processed as a pre-authorization on your credit card and will be released after your departure provided there is no damage, items missing, or extra cleaning required.
• A light housekeeping service is provided from Monday to Friday and a full cleaning is provided every 7 days

description:
The house has two floors with an unfinished basement and backyard. 

Our house is old with a touch of modern feel, please be gentle. Great for relaxing. 

We still live here so you will find that there is one closet that the guest can not use.

 No keys are provided. We will message you with instructions once you arrive.

Keep all doors closed and locked when entering and exiting. 

If you happen to need the windows open please make sure to close and lock windows before checking-out.

We have entrance and exit cameras inside the house.

You can access:
Kitchen 
Bathroom 
Living room 
Dining room
Bedrooms 
Yard

Please message through Airbnb only for any communication.

The house is close to:
Restaurants
Grocery store 
Metra Train
Pace Bus
Parks
Pool
Beach
Downtown Chicago

You can get around by bus, train, Uber or Lyft.

Our house is old. Please be gentle. The chairs can not go directly on the wood floor.

Entrance and exit when coming and going from the house should only be through the back door. 

*Don’t use the garage.
*Don’t use the closet across from the restroom on the first floor.
*The community closet with towels and linen is located on the second floor hallway.
*Do not open any bins or boxes in the basement.

* There are SECURITY CAMERAS in the back entrance , front entrance and basement entrance. There are no other camera in the home other than the ones in the entrances. This is to ensure your safety. 

NO SMOKING in or outside the property. You will be charged $250 if you smoke in or outside the property. 

No drugs, no parties, no guns or weapons everyone staying in the house must be listed and charged if over the capacity of guest, for us it is six guest max $25 each person after six people.
house_rules:
- Guest need to put dirty dishes in dish washer (no need to run it)
- Remove all bedding from beds and put in Baskets provided by the restroom.
- Throw out trash and recycling 
- No shoes on the main and second floor
- No drugs
- No parties 
- No loud noise or music

access: Guests will have access to all of the hotel facilities and public areas. Rooms are private.
description:
Hotel Felix is a stylish, eco-friendly boutique gem in the lively River North area, steps from the Magnificent Mile. It’s successfully combined both luxury and sustainability, and is the first downtown Chicago hotel to receive Silver LEED certification.

You’re greeted by a vintage façade and lobby, while airy interiors bring in elements of earth, wind, water and fire – with floor-to-ceiling windows for maximum light. French bistro with live music Wed-Sat, the Michelin-recommended Taketei Sushi and the cleverly-named Big Shoulders coffee shop.

Your room will include:
Free WiFi
Flat-screen TV
L’Occitane bath amenities
Hairdryer
In-room safe

The space offers:
Troquet River North Restaurant & Bar
Taketei Sushi restaurant
Coffee shop
Live music Wed-Sat
Complimentary morning coffee at Big Shoulders
Fitness room
Valet parking (extra)

Guests will have access to all of the hotel facilities and public areas. Rooms are private.

Our hotel is conveniently located just minutes away from Michigan Avenue. We are in the heart of River North where iconic restaurants (Portillo's, HardRock, Godfrey I|O just to name a few) are just around the corner. River North is most known for its vibrancy and multiple art galleries.

Our hotel is accessible by car, CTA red Line (about 3 blocks away) and bus. Please feel free to call our front desk at 312-447-2954 should you need directions.
The hotel provides valet parking for an extra daily charge ($60). There is also ample self-parking within a few blocks.

We are only minutes away from the CTA red line (Grant Station) and  public transportation by bus is also available around the hotel.  If you arrive early, we will be more than happy to check you in should your room be available. If not, we are more than happy to store your luggage, so that you can start enjoying all that the city has to offer. 
Please note that we do not charge any cleaning fees like many hosts, however we do charge a $13 urban fee daily (plus applicable taxes). This fee is not included into the price you paid to Airbnb and will be due upon check out.  Description of this fee is available on our website at www.hotelfelixchicago.com. Guest must be at least 21 years old and have valid id and credit card to check-in.

access: You'll be able to access the entire apartment minus one closet, but I have racks and bins to store your clothes. You'll have access to laundry down the hall. You'll have access to the gym with the purchase of a pass.
description:
My studio is cozy and has everything you need for your stay in Chicago! It's in an extremely safe part of the city and has very accessible public transportation. Being on the North side of the city, there are plenty of more affordable bars, restaurants, and attractions that I would love to recommend! Please do not hesitate to contact me with any questions that you may have, I will answer promptly. :) I'll leave a flat iron, curling iron, and blow dryer for your use!  Btw the bed is super comfy!

Small studio apartment perfect for 2-3 people! I have a pull out single sofa bed and a full sized bed. The apartment building has a doorman which is a defining security feature. There is on-call maintenance 24-7 and the doorman will help with any questions that may arise during your stay.  

There is one bathroom and one kitchen. In terms of appliances, I have a small blender, a microwave, stove, oven, fridge, freezer, keurig, and toaster oven. I also have a kettle and everything that you may need dish/silverware-wise. Shower towels, toilet paper, paper towels, soap, shampoo and conditioner will all be supplied. The unit has heat, an air conditioner, and a space heater is available as well. 

Feel free to use my candles and essential oil diffuser to make things cozier :)

There is a CVS, ALDI, and Whole Foods near. There is a small well-stocked food-mart across the street.

There is a public gym with a pool attached to our building if you would like to purchase a pass. Its called "Edgewater Athletic Club" and you can email them for information about a pass. 



Laundry and trash shoot are at the end of my hallway. 

Check-in any time 11am-6pm (if you require a different time, we can likely work with you). My dad will meet you at the check-in time and provide the key fob (to get in the main entrance and up the elevator) and door key (to the apartment).

You'll be able to access the entire apartment minus one closet, but I have racks and bins to store your clothes. You'll have access to laundry down the hall. You'll have access to the gym with the purchase of a pass.

I will be in Europe and the Middle East this summer for academic purposes, but my dad will be available in the area as needed. Otherwise, I will have international cellphone service and respond to my calls, texts, and emails promptly if you have any questions. I am more than happy to help explaining the public transportation system in detail, suggest restaurants or night life, and more.

The neighborhood is extremely safe. It is a block away from Loyola University Chicago, so there is a ton of campus security in the area. There is also neighborhood watch and even a Loyola campus security building across the street from here. This apartment is also one block away from the Chicago Red Line which is the 'L' train. This is VERY convenient and I use it to get everywhere. It is also a couple blocks away from major bus stops. Right across the street from here is a highly rated Chicago cafe called Metropolis (I have spend many hours doing homework here). 

The restaurants here are super good and eclectic! I recommend the Ethiopian Diamond a few blocks away, Pete's Pizza on the corner of my street, Flaco's Tacos just under the 'L' train, and am willing to provide many other suggestions. 

Another wonderful thing about the location, its just a block away from Lake Michigan! Right on the lake there is a cafe called The Waterfront Cafe that has a great view and great food. There are plenty of lakefront paths in the area and the Edgewater Beach is very close as well.

Like I said, I am a block away from the Chicago Red Line "Granville" 'L' stop. 
This is the train line that runs North to South so the southbound train will take you straight to downtown without any transfers. It also takes you straight to Wrigley Field! 

Distances:
15 min. to Wrigley Field
30 min. to Water Tower Place
35 min. to Millennium Park
45 min. to Navy Pier
45 min. to the Sky Deck

Please let me know if you want information on the distances and directions to anywhere in the city and I can inform you of the best route!

additional_house_rules: This is a quiet home - no smoking, no alcohol, no drugs, no weapons. We like it peaceful. That said, you are welcome to bring friends over, you can hang out in the living room, watch TV in the living room, use the kitchen, snack in the dining room, log into the hi-speed wireless internet, and engage in meaningful conversation, if you want to. We also have the ability to give you a blazing fast wired connection to the Internet. Just ask. We do have NetFlix.  Please be advised that we do have a small Yorkie-poo dog, named Spy (our daughter named him, long story). He is very, very friendly, and he will likely bark briefly when you come to the door. He's just trying to say hello and to alert us that someone is at the door. After he greets you, he'll probably be sitting by your side or on your lap within ten minutes (if you allow it). Let me add that if you have any discomfort with the dog, we can keep him downstairs or even put him in a cage. You probably won't want to ask for that, but you can if you wish.

access: You can access the entire house. One bathroom is set aside for guests upstairs. But if you gotta go, you can also use the one downstairs too!
description:
Welcoming, warm & comfortable home, BR#3 for up to 1 guest. (LISTING #3 OF 3; see other listings for additional space.) Located close to Hwy 94. 10 miles from Chicago, close to beach & Wilmette, Evanston, Glenview, Skokie. You're welcome to use all the facilities - kitchen, bathrooms, TV, hi-speed Wifi, laundry & parking. Make your breakfast with supplied basics such as cereal, eggs, juice, tea & coffee. Really friendly small Yorkie-poo dog in the home. Meaningful conversation (if you want it).

Owners, Ellen and Ed, live in the lower level of the home. We love having guests and getting to know you. But we'll give you as much privacy as you want.

You can access the entire house. One bathroom is set aside for guests upstairs. But if you gotta go, you can also use the one downstairs too!

Ed works from home as a writer, and can help out with any need you may have. Ed and Ellen would be delighted to spend time with you, if you want that, but don't feel you have to. You can have as much or as little space as you wish.

Our street is very tranquil, with people from diverse backgrounds. Close to grocery, shopping, theater, restaurants, the mall, and other services. Wilmette beach and the Baha'i House of Worship -- Wilmette's leading attraction -- is 10 minutes away.

I have info re the closest bus route and will print it out for you upon request. Easy access to the highway and shopping locations.

access: Entire apartment with 2 floors
description:
Just remodeled the entire house. New bathrooms, new kitchen and new bedrooms. Everything is newly furnished.

The place is in the heart of the Chinatown residential area, and close to the Cermak-Chinatown Redline Station.  Several bus stations are also within a 10 mins. walk.

20 mins. to the Loop and McCormick Place.

Street parking can be found nearby, but do read the signage, as some streets have parking limits or are residential permit parking only.

Please make sure there are no parties :)

5 bedrooms for up to 16 people.
7 full size beds and 2 single beds.
2 bathrooms.
A kitchen and a dinning room.

If street parking is full, there is a public parking lot at 2001 S Wentworth Ave, which is a 10 mins. walk to my place.  It costs $15 for 24 hours. 
Most restaurants in Chinatown offer valet parking which could help reduce your parking costs.

Entire apartment with 2 floors

5 mins. to Cermak-Chinatown Red Line Station;
8 mins. to several bus stations;
5 mins. drive, 10 mins. bus or 20 mins. walk to McCormick Place;
15-20 mins. to Downtown Chicago - the “Loop”;
20 miles to O'Hare International Airport;
9 miles to Midway International Airport.

No PARTY!!!
No PETS!
The quiet time is between 10:00pm - 7:00am, please keep QUIET during this time.
Please do not slam doors, or walk loudly up and down the stairs.

additional_house_rules:
1. Please be aware that you will be required to present your photo ID upon check-in so that we may verify you are the guest who made the reservation. Acceptable forms of ID are limited to: US Driver's License, US State-Issued ID Card, US Military ID, and/or a Passport. We apologize for any inconvenience, but we feel this is important for your safety and ours.

2. All guests must be accounted for in your reservation. Absolutely no unauthorized parties allowed! Arrangements can be made in advance for certain types of parties/events and may include additional fees and security deposits. Please contact hosts for details.

3. No smoking of any substances (including vaporizers) allowed anywhere on the premises. The same goes for use of drugs of any kind.

4. This is a quiet residential neighborhood for the most part, please be respectful of the owners and neighbors when coming and going. Please remove shoes inside the house. Quiet hours from 10:00pm through 8:00am Sunday-Thursday, 11:00pm through 9:00am Friday & Saturday. Outdoor lighting will be turned off once quiet hours begin.

5. The back deck/garden area and grill are reserved for use by the owners only.  Please respect our privacy as we intend to respect yours. Feel free to enjoy the front porch seating area anytime outside of quiet hours. Guests are not, under any circumstances, permitted access to the balcony of the unit.

access: Front and rear entrances allow access to the building and private unit with your phone using Bluetooth technology! Once booked, your hosts will forward you an invitation via our mobile smart-lock app and access will be granted during your stay. You'll have unlimited access to the private, three bedroom unit, and limited access to the garage and laundry facilities upon request and arrangements with your hosts.
description:
Beautiful, private 3BR condo w/all the modern conveniences, just steps from Wrigley Field! Short walk to the El at Addison Red Line stop for easy access to everything Chicago! Discover dozens of shops, restaurants & taverns within walking distance on Clark, Halsted, Broadway, Southport & Irving Park Road, including grocery stores. Stay for a couple days, or a couple weeks - you'll have everything you need no matter what! If you don't find it, just ask - we're right downstairs and happy to help!

This lovely vintage building has hardwood floors and exposed brick throughout, and the interior woodwork has never seen a drop of paint - it's absolutely stunning! The tastefully updated private unit where you'll stay offers a full kitchen with quartz countertops and stainless steel appliances including a microwave. A Keurig coffee maker and K-Cups are provided along with creamer for your morning wake-up with our compliments! The unit has a new heating/cooling system using "Nest" technology to keep you comfy no matter what the temperature outside! Three beautifully furnished bedrooms include two queen-sized beds and one full, and the livingroom has a queen-sized memory foam pull-out sofa. An additional Aerobed air mattress is available to place in the master bedroom or livingroom if needed to accommodate up to ten people. Although our place is kid-friendly, there are no child-safety mechanisms or controls in place, so please be conscientious when bringing your children for a stay. The unit is not suitable for infants under two years of age.

Front and rear entrances allow access to the building and private unit with your phone using Bluetooth technology! Once booked, your hosts will forward you an invitation via our mobile smart-lock app and access will be granted during your stay. You'll have unlimited access to the private, three bedroom unit, and limited access to the garage and laundry facilities upon request and arrangements with your hosts.

The unit where you'll be staying is completely private, but we live right downstairs and are available to answer any questions, and would love to have you join us on our private porch or deck for a beverage and a chat! If we're not home, we will be easily reached via text message to help out with any needs you may have! We will be happy to make recommendations for activities, events and/or restaurants, and offer concierge services such as stocking your fridge for an additional fee.

The condo sits on a quiet, residential street, but it's just a half a block from Wrigley Field (and all of the fun and fanfare that comes with the area). Lake Michigan and Boystown are nearby as well, as are dozens of shops, restaurants, and taverns.

The nearest cross streets are Clark and Waveland, and the Addison "El" stop is just two blocks away. On game days and during events at Wrigley Field, the neighborhood gets very lively and pedestrian and vehicle traffic increases significantly! Getting in and out of the neighborhood in a vehicle can be a challenge during these times, so please plan accordingly. If you have any questions, about dates and times when activity will peak, don't hesitate to ask!

This location is only two blocks from the Addison Red Line "El" stop which will take you to downtown Chicago in just 15-20 minutes! We are within walking distance of dozens of restaurants, shops and taverns, including grocery stores. If you need parking during your stay, arrangements can be made in advance for you to park in our 2-car garage for an additional $40/night per space. Please take care of our home's guest quarters by cleaning up after yourselves as much as possible and leaving the unit in the same condition you found it. Additional cleaning fees above the $150 required fee may apply if the unit needs extensive cleaning after your stay.
house_rules:
1. Please be aware that you will be required to present your photo ID upon check-in so that we may verify you are the guest who made the reservation. Acceptable forms of ID are limited to: US Driver's License, US State-Issued ID Card, US Military ID, and/or a Passport. We apologize for any inconvenience, but we feel this is important for your safety and ours.

2. All guests must be accounted for in your reservation. Absolutely no unauthorized parties allowed! Arrangements can be made in advance for certain types of parties/events and may include additional fees and security deposits. Please contact hosts for details.

3. No smoking of any substances (including vaporizers) allowed anywhere on the premises. The same goes for use of drugs of any kind.

4. This is a quiet residential neighborhood for the most part, please be respectful of the owners and neighbors when coming and going. Please remove shoes inside the house. Quiet hours from 10:00pm through 8:00am Sunday-Thursday, 11:00pm through 9:00am Friday & Saturday. Outdoor lighting will be turned off once quiet hours begin.

5. The back deck/garden area and grill are reserved for use by the owners only.  Please respect our privacy as we intend to respect yours. Feel free to enjoy the front porch seating area anytime outside of quiet hours. Guests are not, under any circumstances, permitted access to the balcony of the unit.

additional_house_rules:
- Must love dogs! Fonzi is a very sensitive little soul and loves to socialize with the guests. If you're allergic or scared of dogs, this probably isn't the best option for you.

- I work during the week and need silence at night after 11 pm. If you'd like to stay up and chat, I ask that you do so in the living room area and not in the bedroom. 

- Out of respect for all of my neighbors, the back deck is closed from 11 pm - 9 am.

- No smoking is allowed in the apartment.

- No guests allowed. I'm happy to host you and a guest, and I certainly don't mind if you have a guest drop by for a few hours, but I do not feel comfortable with any additional overnight guests unless previously discussed.

access: You will have keys to the front doors.
description:
The location of this apartment is great if you're looking for a local experience. The neighborhood is Roscoe Village, which is a super cute (and not to mention quiet) neighborhood just west of Wrigleyville. Down Roscoe, you can find lots of shops, restaurants, and bars! We are only a 2 minute walk to Public Transit!

PLEASE READ, beautiful people: This is PRIVATE ROOM in a 2bed/1 bath, 1,200 square foot, 100 year old apartment where I live with my dog, Fonzi. The larger bedroom of the two; however, is all yours, fully equipped with a 3 drawer chest and closet to help make you feel more at home. The living room has a 40" TV for you to use with over 60 channels to browse. The kitchen is quite large and is equipped with everything you may need. There's a little table in there for you to have your breakfast... OR if you prefer to eat breakfast on the deck, there is a large sectional sofa out there that is mighty comfy! I often sit out there with a cup of coffee and listen to the birds.

You will have keys to the front doors.

I will be available to help you maneuver your way around Chicago. I will also be happy to take you to a local coffee house in the area, if you're interested. I love to interact with travellers as I am a traveller myself. It is my honor to have you as a guest and I will do my best to make sure you have the best time in Chicago.

Roscoe Village has one of the best Chamber of Commerce groups in the city. They are always planning fun festivals and working to keep it a safe and active community. On Roscoe, there are a lot of locally owned shops - coffee houses, boutiques, restaurants, bars, and more! It's a very quaint neighborhood with a lot of tree lined streets.

The CTA is all over the place. If there's one thing about Chicago that I love, it's the ability to get anywhere you want on public transit. Bus routes are on nearly every block and the Brown line "El" is a 15 minute walk from here. We would also like to recommend Lyft or Uber (both phone apps) to use while you're in the city, if public transit isn't your thing. Your time here is valuable and these apps are great for getting you where you need to be, when you need to be there.

The apartment is located on the 2nd floor of a 3 flat building. Please be prepared to climb a flight of stairs during your stay here...

Unfortunately, I do not provide breakfast, but I do provide only the best coffee for my guests. Many guests have swooned over my coffee!
house_rules:
- Must love dogs! Fonzi is a very sensitive little soul and loves to socialize with the guests. If you're allergic or scared of dogs, this probably isn't the best option for you.

- I work during the week and need silence at night after 11 pm. If you'd like to stay up and chat, I ask that you do so in the living room area and not in the bedroom. 

- Out of respect for all of my neighbors, the back deck is closed from 11 pm - 9 am.

- No smoking is allowed in the apartment.

- No guests allowed. I'm happy to host you and a guest, and I certainly don't mind if you have a guest drop by for a few hours, but I do not feel comfortable with any additional overnight guests unless previously discussed.
interaction: I will be available to help you maneuver your way around Chicago. I will also be happy to take you to a local coffee house in the area, if you're interested. I love to interact with travellers as I am a traveller myself. It is my honor to have you as a guest and I will do my best to make sure you have the best time in Chicago.
neighborhood_overview: Roscoe Village has one of the best Chamber of Commerce groups in the city. They are always planning fun festivals and working to keep it a safe and active community. On Roscoe, there are a lot of locally owned shops - coffee houses, boutiques, restaurants, bars, and more! It's a very quaint neighborhood with a lot of tree lined streets.
notes:
The apartment is located on the 2nd floor of a 3 flat building. Please be prepared to climb a flight of stairs during your stay here...

Unfortunately, I do not provide breakfast, but I do provide only the best coffee for my guests. Many guests have swooned over my coffee!
space: PLEASE READ, beautiful people: This is PRIVATE ROOM in a 2bed/1 bath, 1,200 square foot, 100 year old apartment where I live with my dog, Fonzi. The larger bedroom of the two; however, is all yours, fully equipped with a 3 drawer chest and closet to help make you feel more at home. The living room has a 40" TV for you to use with over 60 channels to browse. The kitchen is quite large and is equipped with everything you may need. There's a little table in there for you to have your breakfast... OR if you prefer to eat breakfast on the deck, there is a large sectional sofa out there that is mighty comfy! I often sit out there with a cup of coffee and listen to the birds.
summary: The location of this apartment is great if you're looking for a local experience. The neighborhood is Roscoe Village, which is a super cute (and not to mention quiet) neighborhood just west of Wrigleyville. Down Roscoe, you can find lots of shops, restaurants, and bars! We are only a 2 minute walk to Public Transit!
transit: The CTA is all over the place. If there's one thing about Chicago that I love, it's the ability to get anywhere you want on public transit. Bus routes are on nearly every block and the Brown line "El" is a 15 minute walk from here. We would also like to recommend Lyft or Uber (both phone apps) to use while you're in the city, if public transit isn't your thing. Your time here is valuable and these apps are great for getting you where you need to be, when you need to be there.

description:
HI!

I travel a lot between Chicago and LA, so decided to Airbnb my room while away. It's a very Zen and cozy room, Full size bed, Hammock and an Air Mattress is available upon request.

+ Comfy full size bed

+ Cozy Hammock for relaxing, or reading

+Move the Hammock and make space to for some yoga, exercise, or mediation under the sun.  

+ WORKSPACE
    Work at Desk or From Bed using the bed table
   
+ Full Size Mirror

+ GOOD VIBES FOR ALL

*•♪.¸¸¸.•*¨*•.¸¸ LIVING ROOM ¸.•*•♪¸.•*¨¨*♪

+ BIG OL CHALKBOARD!

An entire wall of our living room is a giant chalkboard! Feel free to let your creativity flow and make chalk drawings all over our wall (just this one wall though!)

+ COUCHES GALORE!
Our living room has 2 large couches and they're great for napping

+ PLANTS, FLOWERS, ARTIFACTS AND ART!
Our house has lots of fun little things to look at

*•♪.¸¸¸.•*¨¨*•.¸ KITCHEN ¸¸.•*•♪¸.•*¨¨*♪

+ WHIP UP SOMETHING TASTY! 
Our house is surrounded by fantastic eateries, but there's endless potential in our kitchen: 
+ Stove
+ Oven
+ Refrigerator
+ Blenders
+ All the pots
+ All the spices
+ All the utensils
+ Dishwasher

*•♪.¸¸¸.•*¨¨*•.¸¸ BATHROOM¸.•*•♪¸.•*¨¨*♪

Your bathroom is on the ground level, stocked with towels, shampoo etc.

*•♪.¸¸¸.•*¨¨*•.¸¸¸ BACK YARD •*•♪¸.•*¨¨*♪
Read a book, soak up some sun, have a drink or do some yoga!

*•♪.¸¸¸.•*¨*•.¸ WASHER + DRYER ¸.•*•♪¸.•*¨*♪

24/7 access so you can stay fresh!
BYOSoap

*•♪.¸¸¸.•*¨*•.¸STORAGE ROOM ¸.•*•♪¸.•*¨*♪ 
Store extra luggage, bikes etc.

*•♪.¸¸¸.•*¨*•. THE ROOMIES ¸¸.•*•♪¸.•*¨*♪
We're all creative professionals: 
+ A Florist And Installation Artist
+ Middle Room for Airbnb Guest
+Event Planner

24/7 ACCESS TO ALL COMMUNITY SPACES
+ Washer/Dryer
+ Living Room
+ Kitchen
+ Bathroom
+ Back Yard
+ Storage Room

I live in a world of Fashion, music, art, culture and events, and I'll introduce you to my favorite things in the city if you'd like.

If I'm out of town, you can always call me for help and advice.

Super Cool Neighborhood, Features · Residential · Easy-Living Feel · Mix Of Shops · Good Restaurants · Boutiques 

Walking distance from the Blue Line that will take you right downtown. 

Between West Town, Buck town, Logan Square and Wicker park, all very cool Neighborhoods as well.

Great variety of nightlife, activities such as bars, clubs, arcades, and restaurants.

Comedy Clubs, Brunch Spots, Cafe's,  Roof Top Pools, Record Stores, Antique Shops, Thrift Stores, and book stores nearby.

Walking Distance from one of the most beautiful and Robust Parks in the City ( Humboldt Park)

Lots of Gym, Yoga and dance Studios in the area  

I can go on and on, but I think you get it.

Walking gets you to shopping, restaurants, boutiques and shops plus it's 15-minute walk to trains to downtown or the quickest Uber drive imaginable. There is a Divvy station (public bike rental) right around the corner.

Unfortunately we can accommodate pets.

additional_house_rules: Disclaimer: please be aware that you are renting a historic 1930s home, not the Four Seasons.  Like all old homes, it has many "charms" and quirks.  Constantly renovating the home is a challenge, yet a passion, and this home is never at any given time in a "perfect, luxurious condition."  For example, the charming kitchen has 3 sinks, but 1 of them doesn't work and, so far, it has proven simply too cost-prohibitive to fix so you'll have to make do with only 2 working kitchens.  The kitchen has other charms, such as almost 75 cabinets and drawers, all from the 60s (and therefore, many of them tend to stick!)  Also, some of the bathrooms have a habit of leaking.  It seems that, we fix one, and then another starts to leak.  Moreover, given that we are a popular, almost constantly rented B&B, we are almost always in need of a "paint job."  No sooner do we complete a $5000 re-paint that it is in need of another one, so we can't guarantee a brand new paint condition; the walls and light switches therefore sometimes appear "dirty.".  The furniture is extremely expensive and delicate European design and craftmanship and, therefore, the slightest sign of wear and tear will be readily evident.  Most of the bathrooms are renovated, and we did our best to preserve their "high 50s" look and feel.  Most of them have 100 little light bulbs -- so charming.  And the downside is that at any given time many of them will be out, and they run hot if you leave them on.  We just can't possibly keep them all working at the same time and often some of the sockets are empty when we are in between replacements.  The doors are old, and sometimes are sticky and please be advised that the lower level bedroom bathrooms do not have doors -- an intentional design by the famed architect Rebori and we have no intention of changing his design.  I would say that 19 out of 20 of our guests are delighted with the historically significant charm of the building and love its quirks, but 1 out of 20 is "shocked" to learn that we are not a modern, perfectly clean Four Seasons (where a 1-BR suite costs $850/night, plus the 20% hotel tax and, by the way, you'll need 3 or 4 of them for 10 people.)  Thanks for understanding in advance and kindly only book this property if you are comfortable with these quirks.

description:
Enjoy Chicago's Gold Coast in the famous Florsheim Mansion. One of the most architecturally significant homes in Chicago, the Mansion is a perfect destination for families or groups with 5 bedrooms and 5 bathrooms; sleeps up to 12.     Please contact us at the Florsheimmansion web/site for a special discount code of 30% savings on any booking.

Important notice: We require a $3000 security deposit after an AirBnB booking is confirmed to be held in an escrow account.  Bookings are not confirmed until the reservation is accepted by AirBnB, and then the security deposit is received separately in the escrow account.  

Enjoy Chicago as “patrons of the arts” in the famous Florsheim Mansion for the Arts B&B in Chicago's Gold Coast at 1328 N. State Parkway. One of the most architecturally significant homes in Chicago, the Florsheim Mansion for the Arts is a perfect destination for families or groups.

The legendary residence was built by famous architect, Andrew Rebori in 1938 and was home to shoe heiress and sculptor, Lillian Florsheim, who purchased the place in 1946.  The famed house has been called one of the "sexiest homes in Chicago" by Chicago Magazine.  It is a significant landmark of the city.  Oozing with architectural brilliance, the home is 4500 square feet and is in the ideal gold coast location with 2 living rooms, a huge outdoor garden, and lots of open gathering spaces.

The historic residence actually has two houses: the Main House and the Guest House  which are connected together via the kitchen.  

The Main House has 3 BR/3B and a den (6 or 7 total beds), the Guest House has 2BR/2B (2 or 3 total beds), combined for a total of 5BR/5B.

The Main House entrance features a small guest bedroom with 2 full beds and full bath/shower, as well as a large den/office with fireplace and a pull-out queen size couch for 2.  Upstairs on the 2nd floor is a very large entertaining Living Room  and a formal Dining Room.  On the third floor is the Master Bedroom with king size bed (can be converted to two full beds) and full bath as well as another guest room with two full size beds (can be combined together) and full bath.

The Guest House features a small bedroom/bath on the 1st floor with 1 or 2 single beds.  The 2nd floor includes a massive Great Room/Art Studio with 20' soaring ceilings, large hearth, and a Media Room with flatscreen TV.  On the third floor is the Master Bedroom with queen size bed and full bath.

Combined, the Main House and Guest House can comfortably sleep 6-11 people.

In terms of entertaining, art events and concert performances, the Living Room with its Steinway Grand Piano can host 40-50 people and the Great Room/Art Studio + Media Room could easily fit a party of 15-20 more, ideal for conferences or large family gatherings.  An outdoor gathering could also be hosted in the Garden.  The Garden features a Zen-like Koi and Turtle Pond.  

In total, the Mansion is fully furnished with 5 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms, high-tech media room, Great Room/Art Studio/Library, living room, dining room, and gardens. Over 5000 square feet of luxurious living space. Located on State Street you are just 2 blocks from the lake, 3 blocks from Michigan Avenue, and 2 blocks from the famous Rush/Division nightlife hub. Parking available and fully pet friendly.  Please feel free to visit the Florsheim Mansion's website.

The Florsheim Mansion for the Arts has long been an important art destination in Chicago.  The home is named after Lillian Florsheim, the shoe empire heiress who was one of the finest sculptors and gala host's of her day.  The home was previously owned by the Director of Chicago's Museum of Contemporary Art.  In recent years the home has been used as an Artist in Residency destination for some of the world's most prestigious artists.  The home also hosts numerous philanthropic events focused especially on showcasing the art, culture and music of the Middle East and other areas of conflict around the world.  In a unique twist, artists are hosted at the mansion by benefactors from the other side of the conflict.  A portion of your vacation rental will be allocated towards these philanthropic activities, as well as the ongoing restoration of the home.

There is a wonderful video of the space on YouTube.  Since AirBnB doesn't allow web links, just type in the regular You Tube url, and then add the following next to it: /watch?v=MEWv8N7rNPo&feature=(URL HIDDEN)

By the Numbers:

1938: The year the house was built by architect Andrew Rebori
1968: The year the floating galley kitchen was built by architect Bertrand Goldberg
$2.3 million: The amount the current owners paid for the home in (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN): The amount invested so far in our ongoing restoration efforts
5: Number of bedrooms 
5: Number of bathrooms
$3000: refundable security deposit
1: Number of turtles living in the garden pond (his name is Wilbur, please feed him)
Yes: whether or not we rent the space for weddings and events.  Please inquire
2: Number of blocks to Lake Michigan
5: Number of blocks to Michigan Avenue and Magnificent Mile
3: Number of blocks to Rush Street and the best restaurants in Chicago
1: Number of cars that will fit in the garage (at $40/day)
No: Whether or not you really need a car since you can walk to nearly everything
Uber: the app you should download before you come just in case you need a car
1: Number of blocks to the bus stop that take you to downtown 
10: number minutes cab ride to Wrigley Field

The Gold Coast is unsurpassed in Chicago as THE neighborhood for shopping, dining, and walking.  You are steps from the Magnificent Mile, Rush Street, and most of the city's major attractions.

There is a beautiful video of the space which can be found at www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZQxhpeDzOEE&feature=youtu.be

I would say that 19 out of 20 of our guests are delighted with the historically significant charm of the building and love its quirks, but 1 out of 20 is "shocked" to learn that we are not a modern, perfectly clean Four Seasons (where a 1-BR suite costs $850/night, plus the 20% hotel tax and, by the way, you'll need 3 or 4 of them for 10 people.)  Thanks for understanding in advance and kindly only book this property if you are comfortable with these quirks.
neighborhood_overview: The Gold Coast is unsurpassed in Chicago as THE neighborhood for shopping, dining, and walking.  You are steps from the Magnificent Mile, Rush Street, and most of the city's major attractions.
notes: There is a beautiful video of the space which can be found at www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZQxhpeDzOEE&feature=youtu.be
space:
Important notice: We require a $3000 security deposit after an AirBnB booking is confirmed to be held in an escrow account.  Bookings are not confirmed until the reservation is accepted by AirBnB, and then the security deposit is received separately in the escrow account.  

Enjoy Chicago as “patrons of the arts” in the famous Florsheim Mansion for the Arts B&B in Chicago's Gold Coast at 1328 N. State Parkway. One of the most architecturally significant homes in Chicago, the Florsheim Mansion for the Arts is a perfect destination for families or groups.

The legendary residence was built by famous architect, Andrew Rebori in 1938 and was home to shoe heiress and sculptor, Lillian Florsheim, who purchased the place in 1946.  The famed house has been called one of the "sexiest homes in Chicago" by Chicago Magazine.  It is a significant landmark of the city.  Oozing with architectural brilliance, the home is 4500 square feet and is in the ideal gold coast location with 2 living rooms, a huge outdoor garden, and lots of open gathering spaces.

The historic residence actually has two houses: the Main House and the Guest House  which are connected together via the kitchen.  

The Main House has 3 BR/3B and a den (6 or 7 total beds), the Guest House has 2BR/2B (2 or 3 total beds), combined for a total of 5BR/5B.

The Main House entrance features a small guest bedroom with 2 full beds and full bath/shower, as well as a large den/office with fireplace and a pull-out queen size couch for 2.  Upstairs on the 2nd floor is a very large entertaining Living Room  and a formal Dining Room.  On the third floor is the Master Bedroom with king size bed (can be converted to two full beds) and full bath as well as another guest room with two full size beds (can be combined together) and full bath.

The Guest House features a small bedroom/bath on the 1st floor with 1 or 2 single beds.  The 2nd floor includes a massive Great Room/Art Studio with 20' soaring ceilings, large hearth, and a Media Room with flatscreen TV.  On the third floor is the Master Bedroom with queen size bed and full bath.

Combined, the Main House and Guest House can comfortably sleep 6-11 people.

In terms of entertaining, art events and concert performances, the Living Room with its Steinway Grand Piano can host 40-50 people and the Great Room/Art Studio + Media Room could easily fit a party of 15-20 more, ideal for conferences or large family gatherings.  An outdoor gathering could also be hosted in the Garden.  The Garden features a Zen-like Koi and Turtle Pond.  

In total, the Mansion is fully furnished with 5 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms, high-tech media room, Great Room/Art Studio/Library, living room, dining room, and gardens. Over 5000 square feet of luxurious living space. Located on State Street you are just 2 blocks from the lake, 3 blocks from Michigan Avenue, and 2 blocks from the famous Rush/Division nightlife hub. Parking available and fully pet friendly.  Please feel free to visit the Florsheim Mansion's website.

The Florsheim Mansion for the Arts has long been an important art destination in Chicago.  The home is named after Lillian Florsheim, the shoe empire heiress who was one of the finest sculptors and gala host's of her day.  The home was previously owned by the Director of Chicago's Museum of Contemporary Art.  In recent years the home has been used as an Artist in Residency destination for some of the world's most prestigious artists.  The home also hosts numerous philanthropic events focused especially on showcasing the art, culture and music of the Middle East and other areas of conflict around the world.  In a unique twist, artists are hosted at the mansion by benefactors from the other side of the conflict.  A portion of your vacation rental will be allocated towards these philanthropic activities, as well as the ongoing restoration of the home.

There is a wonderful video of the space on YouTube.  Since AirBnB doesn't allow web links, just type in the regular You Tube url, and then add the following next to it: /watch?v=MEWv8N7rNPo&feature=(URL HIDDEN)
summary: Enjoy Chicago's Gold Coast in the famous Florsheim Mansion. One of the most architecturally significant homes in Chicago, the Mansion is a perfect destination for families or groups with 5 bedrooms and 5 bathrooms; sleeps up to 12.     Please contact us at the Florsheimmansion web/site for a special discount code of 30% savings on any booking.

access: Guests are welcome to spend time in their rooms and all of the home's common areas, including a large living room and kitchen.
description:
Family home with two bedrooms for lodgers, located a block away from the California Blue Line Subway stop (40 minutes to O'Hare & 15 minutes to downtown) in the heart of Logan Square, a neighborhood packed with restaurants & bars. Breakfast included!

We are Spanish-American family that has traveled extensively and loves meeting people from around the world.  We've rented the extra rooms in our single-family home to international students studying in Chicago for over two decades, so we are no strangers to sharing our home with a diverse group of people.  We love all things cultural, and would be happy to orient you during your stay and recommend places to visit, sites to see and places to eat.

Guests are welcome to spend time in their rooms and all of the home's common areas, including a large living room and kitchen.  

Logan Square is a vibrant neighborhood teaming with young people and lots of restaurants, bars and cafes.  Walk five minutes in any direction, at any time of day and you are bound to find something interesting.  Plus we're two train stops from the equally trendy Wicker Park neighborhood and a 15 minute ride from downtown Chicago.

We're located just one block from the California "EL" Station on the Blue Line.  This subway line takes you directly to O'Hare Airport (30 minutes) and Downtown Chicago (15 minutes).  We're also next to the California Ave., Milwaukee Ave. and Fullerton Ave. bus lines.

We have two very friendly and inquisitive cats.  You can keep them from entering your room, but know that you will be sharing the common areas with them.
The room currently has a queen bed and a single bed so that as many as three guests can sleep comfortably.

2. Feel free to use the kitchen, but please clean up after yourself.
3. Keep noise at a minimum in the late evening and early morning.

description:
Located just a couple train stops away from downtown Chicago, this second floor condo offers both convenience and comfort. The large living room and bar style kitchen provide plenty of space.

The open layout of this apartment and its tall ceilings make it a space suitable for up to six people. The sliding glass doors in the living room and bedroom along with the skylight windows provide plenty of natural lighting across the apartment.

description:
The apartment is a recently renovated space with new vinyl floors, new appliances, and a renovated bathroom with two sinks. The private room, with a lock, includes a new mattress, new pillows, and a 50" smart TV. The kitchen includes a microwave, Nespresso machine, and dishwasher. We decorated the space with an urban chic decor that is still warm and cozy.

Wether for short or long stays, you will feel comfortable for your whole stay at our apartment. There is a lock on your room door so you can have privacy. Along with 50” Smart TV mounted to the wall, and an Alexa echo dot to listen to music and set alarms.

I will be available to assist. Please feel free to reach out to me without hesitation for any questions.

Pilsen, named one of the top 12 coolest neighborhoods in the world by Forbes magazine in 2019, is also my favorite neighborhood in Chicago. 

I grew up in New York and lived in Miami for 5 years before living in Chicago. In Mexico, they called places like Pilsen, "lugares magicos" or magical places. Pilsen celebrates Mexican culture in a modern world like no other neighborhood in Chicago. The art, the food, the local bars, and, most importantly, the sense of community makes this my favorite neighborhood in Chicago. 

There are various local coffee shops and bars to meet new people within walking distance such as the Jumping Bean and Step Down or Harbee's and Twisted Cantina,  hosting some of the best house DJ's in Chicago. 

You can find what I consider the best tacos in Chicago in Pilsen. For al pastor (pork) tacos, check out Atotonilco. For carnitas tacos, try Uruapan. Finally, for carne asada tacos, go to El Milagro. All of these restaurants are also within walking distance.

You will find an extensive list of recommendations of places to go and see in Chicago in our guidebook.

This is a prime location to access all parts of the city of  Chicago to enjoy all it has to offer. It is 3 blocks from 18th St., the heart and center of Pilsen, providing food, bars, and a local supermarket. The Pink CTA line is a 7 minute walk from the apartment This can take you directly to downtown in 10 minutes. There is also access to the 60 Bus route directly in front of the house, which will take you straight to Millennium Park.

access: You will get access to the entire apartment. 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen, living room.
description:
This 2-bedroom/2-bath apt is located literally one block away from Michigan Ave and Millenium Park. The Chicago River is just three blocks away. All CTA lines within one/two blocks distance!

This is a beautiful corner unit in downtown Chicago. There is plenty of natural light in every room. You will enjoy some views out into the city. 

There is a large master bedroom that has two queen-sized beds and a smaller bedroom that has a single full-sized bed with an en-suite bathroom. The second bathroom is located in the living room. 

There is also a sleeper couch in the living room that opens to a queen-sized bed.

You will get access to the entire apartment. 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen, living room.

Highly available at any time of the day. Please feel free to reach me with any question, issue or concern you may have! 

Communication through the AirBnB platform is preferred.

You will be in downtown Chicago. There are endless activities all year round. Walking distance from the Art Institute of Chicago, the Cloud Gate, Millenium Park, Grant Park, Buckingham Fountain, etc. There are plenty of fancy restaurants nearby as well as shopping available in State street and the Magnificent Mile in Michigan Ave. The Chicago River is 3 blocks away.

You will be in 'The Loop'. This means you will be connected to all CTA train lines, walking distance from the Blue Line that will take you to-from the airport in less time than it takes to drive. There are hundreds of bus lines that pass through within a block that will take you anywhere in the Chicago area.

Feel free to use the kitchen and cook to your hearts contempt. If anything is not up to your expectations, please reach out to me and I will resolve it as soon as possible.

access: Guest have access to the full apartment. The space is not shared.
description:
My condo is in the middle of everything. It’s an easy commute to the University of Chicago campus, the lake front, The Magnificent Mile, McCormick Place and Wintrust arena to name a few. The unit has been newly remolded and is beautifully decorated. All of the amenities of home are right here waiting on your enjoyment, including the fireplace. You have use of the entire space which includes 2 private bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms. WiFi is available to you along with smart TV accessibility.

My guests have full access to everything my space has to offer. The space is so comfortable and relaxing. You can spend the day inside and Netflix and chill, cook a meal or order out, relax in front of the fireplace or just sleep in. Either way would work. Quick uber ride everywhere to visit all that the city has to offer.

Guest have access to the full apartment. The space is not shared.

I am always just a quick text/call away. After hours my cohost is available to assist.

My place is midway between everything. Very close to 35th st beach, University Of Chicago Medical Campus, downtown Chicago, Navy Pier, McCormick place/ Wintrust arena and Museum of science and industry to name a few.

Uber is the preferred method of choice. Lyft is also available. Luxury transportation service is available upon request at an additional rate. Please request this service in your booking inquiry if needed.

- You agree to the following:
- 
- CHECK-IN: is on or after 5 PM unless otherwise agreed to in writing as our cleaning staff needs sufficient time to prepare. Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing 
- KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB
- BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you 
- QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. Any additional occupants in excess of the # on your reservation must be approved by me whether in your unit or in common areas. Any damage from you or your guests will result in immediate expulsion, at an additional cost to you, a claim with Airbnb and subsequent legal action 
- SMOKING: whether inside your unit, in a common area or roof deck, no smoking of any substance is allowed. Smoke damage to a unit will result in a $1000 fee
- PETS: you understand pets are not allowed in your unit. Pet damage may result in additional fees
- MISSING ITEMS: will be charged to you in a claim 
- ID CHECK: per the rules of this community, we'll request you submit your Government Issued Photo ID at the time of your e-check in via our site. You'll have to also agree to our terms of service. We're required to do a public records check for certain communities
- BREACH: any violation of the above shall result in immediate removal from the property at an additional cost to you
- BOOKING WITHIN 24 HRS: We'll send a request for a $500-1000 deposit which shall be fully returned on checkout

description:
Gorgeous 2BD/2BA Unit in the heart of Chicago - Rivernorth. Professionally managed and cleaned with stylish kitchen, free high-speed wifi and 24/7 support. Fully stocked with all the convenience you would expect at a hotel.

We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week

Cozy and modern apartment units situated along Chicago's River North District. A few minutes away from the Chicago Riverwalk, the Puerto Convention Center and the Shedd Aquarium, along with hundreds of art galleries and local museums. The brown and the purple lines are the main mode of transportation in the city. Amenities include a 24Hr fitness center, a business center with wifi hot spots, hospitable accommodation and a rooftop swimming pool. All units include a modern kitchen, floor to ceiling windows, in-unit washer/dryers and flat screen TV's. Free fast wifi, kitchen/cookware and bathroom amenities are also provided. For any concerns, our amazing customer support team is available to assist.

We offer rewards and complimentary upgrades to our regular repeat guests

access:
You have the complete first floor to yourself with two bedrooms - one with a queen bed and the other with two twin beds.  There a full dining room and living room.  Lots of closet space with plenty of hangers plus a dresser for your use. There is a full yard with a garden to relax in and charcoal grill.  Free laundry available if you should need it.  There is also a small enclosed back porch overlooking the yard, perfect spot to hang out and work or read a book!


PLEASE NOTE - There is no TV, but you have full internet access. There is also a Bose bluetooth speaker.  It is very easy to find parking on my street - often directly in front.  There is coffee and tea and some light staples for breakfast like cereal and fruit.  The beds are all new and super comfy memory foam with high quality sheets and each one has a down comforter.
description: Unwind in this stylish, welcoming apartment on the border of Logan Square & Avondale - 1/2 mile walk to the Logan Square Blue Line stop & with convenient free street parking. Distinctive and original woodwork, a renovated full kitchen, and new bathroom with deep soaking tub make this an ideal place to relax after exploring the city.
house_rules:
Before you inquire about a stay please make sure you complete your profile with photo & info about yourself as I have done so we both know a little about each other.
Please have fully verified profile if you are interested in this rental, at least one review and a government-issued ID.
Please let me know a little about  your trip & who all will be staying when you inquire.

Check in anytime after 3, check out by 11am sharp. Please confirm you understand the check out time and that you need to lock up, put keys in lockbox and text me when you leave.

This is my home, not a hotel so please confirm that you understand I expect you to respect the space as you would your own home, clean up kitchen after yourself & load and start dishwasher before you leave and put things back where you found them.
Thank You!
interaction: I live upstairs and am happy to help direct you or leave you with all  information listed in my guidebook and let you explore for yourself.  I love this city, know it very well and am happy to share info about all the magic it has to offer with anyone who is interested.  I am easily reachable through technology if you have any problems.
neighborhood_overview: Situated on the border of the booming neighborhood of Logan Square, this apartment offers the opportunity to enjoy the local food, art, architecture, and music all within an easy stroll, as well as easy public transport links into the city. 10 minute walk to the heart of Logan Square restaurants, theater, coffee shops and bars.
notes:
Fresh linens and fluffy towels provided. 
Dishes, cookware basics supplied.
Warm and cozy in the winter with super efficient (and quiet!) hot water radiator heat.  
Two a/c window units (did I mention the bldg is from 1904?)  which more than cool the entire apartment.  Also ceiling fans in every room! New windows that open easily.
Back door is self locking so make sure to take keys with you if you go out to enjoy yard!!
No additional guests without permission and additional fee.
No parties.
space: This beautiful vintage building has all the original woodwork that has never been painted - a rare find in this city.  The kitchen is new and the bathroom has been newly renovated and has a deep soaking tub for relaxing after a full day of travel and exploration.  Tons of natural light.  Situated directly between Belmont & Logan Square blue line stops (half mile or less to either) it is super convenient to get to & from airport or to visit any other place in the city.  Quick, easy walk to so many great restaurants/coffee shops/cocktail lounges/bars in the neighborhood.  It's a short walk to a grocery store if you want to stay in and cook. Less than 10 minute walk to the beautifully restored Logan Theater and the Farmer's Market and even closer to many popular restaurants & bars.
summary: Unwind in this stylish, welcoming apartment on the border of Logan Square & Avondale - 1/2 mile walk to the Logan Square Blue Line stop & with convenient free street parking. Distinctive and original woodwork, a renovated full kitchen, and new bathroom with deep soaking tub make this an ideal place to relax after exploring the city.
transit: Easy street parking, a few short blocks to train, grocery store, coffee shops, restaurants, theater, music venues, cocktail lounges, farmer's market. Enterprise or zip car rental available within a block. Divvy bikes available at train station.

access: Parking is available in the driveway. Private access to the suite is adjacent to the parking. A washer dryer is available in the basement.
description:
Outstanding location in the heart of the Frank Lloyd Wright district. Also within walking distance to the El, Metra and downtown Oak Park restaurants and shopping. Beautiful Victorian mansion on historic avenue. Large 2 room suite with private entrance, walk-in closet, new bathroom with marble shower and off street parking.

Unique opportunity to stay in one of the largest Victorian mansions in Oak Park. Private access, very quiet and perfectly located to experience the Frank Lloyd Wright district.

Parking is available in the driveway. Private access to the suite is adjacent to the parking. A washer dryer is available in the basement.

I have lived in the house for 30 years. With my daughters having moved out, the best suite is now available.  I take my cues on interacting with guests from them. As an architect, I have a wealth of information about the neighborhood and area.

Seven Frank Lloyd Wright houses are on the same street.  These houses are among his most famous in the world. International travelers stroll by throughout the year. The Frank Lloyd Wright home including studio and gift shop is steps away.  Multiple options for transportation are within walking distance including the commuter train and the elevated subway.

The Metra and El stops are a 10 minute walk away.

access:
There are some stairs to climb to get to the loft from the studio on the second floor. 
You will have access to the fully equipped kitchen, living room area with TV (Netflix), deck and backyard.
description:
Welcome to your private loft in our Westmont home!     
Perfect for business travelers visiting or working in the area.  
We are on the bus route to Argonne National Lab (Pace Bus 715 - 20 min, 10 min by car) , 1.7 miles to Westmont train station, and 24 miles from downtown Chicago (40 min driving).   
The neighborhood is very safe and peaceful, close to parks, walking distance of  shopping (Walgreens, Mariano's, Aldi, Whole Foods), restaurants and sports bars.  Great for walking and jogging.

The loft feels very cozy and spacious with a queen size bed and a large desk with a comfortable chair. It sits above the studio, which has a table, chair, walk-in closet, an extra fridge and coffee maker, if you don't want to go to the kitchen downstairs.  This is your private space with semi-private entrance through the stairs off of the main entrance door. 
You also have your own private bathroom with shower down the hallway.

There are some stairs to climb to get to the loft from the studio on the second floor. 
You will have access to the fully equipped kitchen, living room area with TV (Netflix), deck and backyard.

We work full time, so we are usually out of the house by 7:30AM on weekdays.    
I like to have the kitchen on weekends and by 6:00PM to cook on a daily basis.  Feel free to use it when we are not at home! 
I offer free breakfast with homemade bread and jelly, choice of cereal and yogurt.

The neighborhood is residential, very safe and quiet, within walking distance of parks, ponds, grocery stores, sports bars and restaurants.  
There is a Mariano's, a Whole Foods, an Aldi and a Walgreens within 4 minutes driving distance, about 15 minutes walking.   
Great for walking or jogging.

We are about 1.7 miles to the Westmont Metra station with trains to downtown Chicago. 
There is a Pace bus pick-up in front of the house on week days between 6:30 and 8:00AM to go to the station ,and in the evenings.   However, it is best to have a car to drive around.
We are on the Pace bus route 715 to Argonne National Lab.   The bus stop is about 5 minutes walking distance from the house.   There are 2 buses in the morning and in the evening. The bus drops you off at the gate of Argonne Lab.

We have two adorable pets:  Mufassa, a furry Persian cat, and Maxx, a very friendly Golden Retriever.   Maxx gets excited to meet you, then settles downs.   Mufassa sleeps most of the time, but loves to be pet as well.

access: Guests are provided access to the coffee bar and the common ares of the home.
description:
Rest and relax in an art filled will appointed condo that feels like a home. My place is close to lake front beaches and bike trails; free on street parking; easy 10-15 minute Uber access to McCormick place, Chicago’s Magnificent Mile, Grant & Millennium Parks, Soldiers & U.S. Cellular Fields and lake Museums and the Shed Aquarium. Comforts of a hotel but in a home at your disposal: cable TV, coffee and tea service and kitchen access. Bathroom across the hall. All bedrooms have keypad locks.

My place is Superhost site great for guest needing 1- 4 private rooms. Set your Filter to see Superhost to better locate my rooms.  My home is comprised of a 4 bedroom condo with 4 of the rooms devoted to hosting Airbnb guests: The Champagne Suite, The Marney Room,  The Sleeping Study and The Deeply Rooted Room. Most weekends all 4 rooms are booked so feel free to mingle with other guests.

Guests are provided access to the coffee bar and the common ares of the home.

My wonderful Co-Host  Akilha is always on site for great conversation and interaction if needed.

For the most up-to-date things to do and places to eat please see: 

1. Chicago Events & Things to Do | Metromix Chicago
2. Metromix Chicago: Chicago Entertainment, Events & Restaurants

The condo is a 15 minute walk to Oakwood Beach. 1 Block form the downtown bus stop and a 10-15 minute walk from the 43 street Greenline Train stop.

access: The entire place
description:
A rare find indeed!
This unique, vintage loft space, is in a private wing of the penthouse, it's both quiet and serene, for the perfect get away! 
Located on historic "Motor Row" near the heart of it all. Attractions include: 
McCormick place, Soldiers Field, Museum Campus, The Chicago Symphony Orchestra, The Art Institute, Millennium Park, Grant Park, The Magnificent Mile, , White Sox Park, Chinatown, and much more! 
Transportation is outside the front door and only steps away from the train.

This space is a working artists loft. A hairstylists live/work space, you're welcome to use shampoo bowl and styling station, if necessary.

The entire place

I'm available by phone until midnight, afterwards please use app.

Our block is hot!
We are literally near everything!
On our block there are great rooftops, outdoor patios, and "Lips" drag cabaret and supper club coming August 2019. VU, Fat Pour, Jerk Villa, Motor Row Brewery, all in a one block radius.

Public transportation is literally at the front door, the CTA bus line goes to all the attractions.  The train is only one block West of us, and If you're a walker, you're a straight shot towards everything, walk out the front door and just go north.

The building is mixed use, meaning commercial and residential. Only residents are here at night. Businesses keep normal business hours.
house_rules:
No shoes inside
No loud music after 10p
interaction: I'm available by phone until midnight, afterwards please use app.
